speaker: Claude
text: It's almost time to invade the Imperial capital. We still don't know where Rhea is, but if she's alive, she's likely in Enbarr. Hopefully we manage to find her without too much trouble.

speaker: Byleth
text: We need to save her quickly.

speaker: Claude
text: I know, but if we're not careful she'll just be whisked away again.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wonder if she's alive.

speaker: Claude
text: If the Empire has some reason to keep Rhea alive, then she's alive.

speaker: Claude
text: I'm sure you must be anxious to see her again.

speaker: Byleth
text: I need to see her again.

speaker: Claude
text: I understand. You need to see Rhea again so you can figure out who you really are.

speaker: Byleth
text: All I care about right now is saving her.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, if that's what you want, I'll do my best to make it happen.

speaker: Claude
text: But we're going up against Edelgard here... It won't be so simple.

speaker: Hilda
text: Our next stop is the Imperial capital. We've sure come a long way.

speaker: Raphael
text: What're you talking about? This is Garreg Mach! It's where we started.

speaker: Hilda
text: I didn't mean literally, Raphael. I was speaking symbolically!

speaker: Lorenz
text: My earnest desire to protect the Alliance has carried me this far. It will not fail me. I am sure the rest of you all have your own reasons to fight as well. Of course, I understand that the fight will not end until we defeat the Empire... And now the time has arrived at long last to march on the Imperial capital and defeat the emperor...

speaker: Hilda
text: It really gets you thinking, doesn't it? We all come from different places and have different goals and dreams. But thanks to those two, we were all able to come together and overcome all sorts of challenges.

speaker: Lysithea
text: You are referring to Claude and the professor, I assume. Even within our own odd group, those two are particularly unusual.

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh! So, you are aware that you're odd!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Well... That's... It was simply a figure of speech. I am speaking about Claude and the professor right now!

speaker: Marianne
text: They're like the wind and the trees...

speaker: Hilda
text: Huh? Claude and the professor are? What does that even mean, and who is which?

speaker: Marianne
text: Oh, um... I was just thinking that if we're the birds, then those two are like the trees and the wind. The professor is a great tree that kindly embraces us and watches over us as we perch on its branches... And Claude is like the wind, pushing us forward as we soar across the open sky...

speaker: Hilda
text: Hm. The metaphor about the professor is solid, but I think Claude just blows us around on a whim. Still, we owe him a lot.

speaker: Ignatz
text: I think that's beautiful, Marianne. I can really picture it. When the war is over, I'd love to paint a picture of those two. Oh! And of all the people we've fought with as well!

speaker: Leonie
text: You mean like a historical painting? I like that! Maybe our descendants will look at it a long, long time from now...

speaker: Lorenz
text: I must say, that piques my interest. I look forward to seeing how you portray my valiant efforts.

speaker: Leonie
text: When you put it that way, we may be witnessing one of the greatest events in Fódlan's history. It's a lot of pressure, but the sense of duty I feel is even stronger than the fear.

speaker: Raphael
text: I'm just happy to be here with all of you! I won't get scared, no matter what we face!

speaker: Hilda
text: We have our goal. Enbarr, the Imperial Capital. Let's get to work!

speaker: Claude
text: My friend! The reinforcements the lords sent are finally gathering. Truth be told, Fort Merceus would've made for a better base of operation. But that weird pillar of light changes things. It's pretty scary, honestly... I wonder what it is...

speaker: Byleth
text: The rage of the goddess.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, that is how the legend goes in Ailell. If it really was the rage of the goddess, let's do our best not to enrage her even further.

speaker: Byleth
text: Some kind of magic.

speaker: Claude
text: Makes sense. But whatever it was, I've never seen destructive power quite like it. I wonder where it came from...

speaker: Byleth
text: A natural phenomenon.

speaker: Claude
text: You think it's natural? What, the planet just up and decided to take a shot at the fort? I dunno, Teach.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, I guess pondering it is a waste of energy for now. Let's just get ready to move out. The capital is Edelgard's domain, so she has the advantage. It's going to be a tough battle.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I was taught from a young age to believe that the creed of Seiros was just the way of the world. To question it never even occurred to me. But Claude and Edelgard are different. They challenge the common wisdom. Even defy it. It is uncomfortable to discard familiar assumptions. But that is an essential quality of the visionary. Indeed, true greatness must lie beyond common sense. Hmm, that's good. I should write that down.

speaker: Raphael
text: We're heading up to Enbarr next. I hope I make it back safe so I can tell my little sis about it! I hear they got a neat opera house there where Manuela used to perform. What was it called again?

speaker: Byleth
text: Mitreflanc Opera Company.

speaker: Raphael
text: Nah, that doesn't sound right!

speaker: Byleth
text: Mittlefrank Opera Company.

speaker: Raphael
text: Ah, that's the one!

speaker: Byleth
text: Mildewplank Opera Company.

speaker: Raphael
text: Nah, that doesn't sound right!

speaker: Raphael
text: My little sis always goes on about how much she'd like to see 'em perform. I know we can't see a show, but do you think we could at least see the building?

speaker: Ignatz
text: We're about to put the finishing touches on this war. I wonder how Fódlan will look without the backdrop of death and destruction. I can't wait to see it! On the other hand, I'm terrified of what the future might hold. Who knows if I'll survive the assault on the capital?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Invading the capital and smashing the Empire. I wonder if doing so could really end this war. Care to share your thoughts, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: I think it'll end the war.

speaker: Lysithea
text: You say that with such confidence. I want to believe that it's true.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Perhaps you feel similarly to me. The whole mess puts me on edge.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Although for now, better to focus my efforts on the fight at hand.

speaker: Marianne
text: If we can win this war, then Claude will be the king of Fódlan, and… Maybe he'll tear down the wall that separates Fódlan from the outside world.

speaker: Byleth
text: Perhaps he will.

speaker: Byleth
text: Perhaps he won't.

speaker: Marianne
text: I know it's hard to imagine… But I really hope he does. It would be so much better if people could live together instead of apart. I might even be able to live an ordinary life in the world Claude envisions…

speaker: Hilda
text: Fighting in the capital! Ugh! And we're fighting against Edelgard! Double ugh! But with you leading us, Professor, I know we'll win. Yeah! Wahoo! Fighting! I'm a little scared, to be honest. I'm just shouting to relieve the tension, but I'll be fine.

speaker: Leonie
text: We're finally going to the capital. This will be my chance to avenge Captain Jeralt. Once we smash the Empire, I'm sure his soul will finally be able to rest in peace.

speaker: Byleth
text: I think you're right.

speaker: Byleth
text: Who can say for sure?

speaker: Leonie
text: Monica killed Captain Jeralt for the Flame Emperor, and the Flame Emperor was Edelgard. I know that the future of all Fódlan rests on this battle. Nothing else is more important. But for me, this is personal. For Captain Jeralt's sake, I'm going to give it all I've got and more!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Professor. At last, the end is nigh. I love the Empire. Part of me wants it to survive. But I know that is not reasonable. The Empire's time has come. What we need now is a mighty leader who can rebuild Fódlan and rule it as a single nation. Nonetheless, it saddens me that we will not have an Adrestian emperor…

speaker: Linhardt
text: They used to call Enbarr the city of Seiros... To assault it, together with the knights, is surreal. If Seiros were alive today, I wonder what she might make of our war... In Enbarr, there was once a Southern Church, and apparently a bishop was dispatched to it. A hundred years ago, the Southern Church became entangled in an insurrection. Until five years ago, the Empire and the church maintained a certain distance from one another.

speaker: Caspar
text: It's such a relief that we've made it this far without having to fight my father.

speaker: Byleth
text: You'll have to face him at some point.

speaker: Caspar
text: Hey, don't try and scare me!

speaker: Byleth
text: It sounds like you're scared.

speaker: Caspar
text: You bet I'm scared! The Imperial army hasn't lost a single battle with my father on the field!

speaker: Caspar
text: If he turns up as a reinforcement during the assault, we might lose. I better make my peace with that.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Professor! My, um, my mother might be in the city. I don't have many good memories of her if I'm being honest, but she's dearer to me than my father. If you happen to see her, please make sure she's not caught up in all the fighting. She's only a civil servant, so hopefully she takes a cue from her Bernie and stays inside.

speaker: Dorothea
text: The whole of the capital is going to be a battleground. The city has such a long heritage… Even so, perhaps it deserves to be reduced to ashes for once. But we can’t let the commonfolk get hurt. We should try to confine the damage to the noble section of town.

speaker: Petra
text: Five years ago...Edelgard said a thing to me. Brigid is a vassal of the Empire. But she also said I always have the freedom to be choosing whether I am with or not with her. I will become the ruler of Brigid. So she said I must make my own path. So now, my path and her path will be colliding.

speaker: Felix
text: The Death Knight is no ordinary knight. I will prey upon him. I will quench my blade's thirst with his blood. His focus is on fighting you, I'm sure. But mine will be the last face he sees.

speaker: Ashe
text: Those things appeared as soon as we got ourselves set up in Fort Merceus. Think what might have happened if they'd have hit us during the battle at Gronder Field. Assuming it was the work of the Imperial army...

speaker: Sylvain
text: So Enbarr, the Capital of the Empire. It's finally time. I never thought I'd live this long. It's like any battle, really--stay calm, stay focused. Don't give in to your enemy or your own fear.

speaker: Byleth
text: You seem more serious than usual.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Hey, I'm always serious! When I'm chasing girls or preparing for battle, always serious. That's me...

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll get through this together.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Striking down the Empire is my offering to His Highness. Heh, I left the Kingdom... What am I saying?

speaker: Mercedes
text: It's been so long since I've been to the Imperial capital. I used to go to the opera there with my mother and brother. I never thought my return would be like this...

speaker: Annette
text: Enbarr… Never in my wildest dreams did I imagine I'd be returning like this. Of course, most of the nobles in the Empire make their home in the capital. In the Kingdom, all nobles live in their own domains. So if the capital is attacked, it doesn't necessarily affect them directly. What will happen to the Imperial nobles when their capital becomes a battlefield?

speaker: Ingrid
text: Once this battle is over, what will become of Faerghus and Fódlan?

speaker: Byleth
text: Peace will reign.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Peace, you say? It sounds so…foreign, so unattainable. But maybe, just maybe.

speaker: Byleth
text: What would you like to see happen?

speaker: Ingrid
text: My hope is for a world at peace. A world in which this present turmoil is a thing of the past—the stuff of legends.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I believe those who survive the atrocities of war have a duty to create a new, better world. So the sooner we can stamp out such turmoil, the better. We must win, Professor. There is no alternative here. I won’t allow for anything else.

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhea will be somewhere in the city. I wonder if she can sense us coming. If we are able to save her, then I expect you will learn many secrets that have hitherto been kept from you. Are you prepared for that?

speaker: Byleth
text: I am.

speaker: Seteth
text: Excellent.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think I'm ready yet.

speaker: Seteth
text: That is unfortunate. Well, you must become ready.

speaker: Seteth
text: The battle will soon be upon us. Let us both be at our best for what is to come.

speaker: Flayn
text: I was born in Enbarr. My mother and father met in a church there. Not too long after, I was brought into the world. I do not understand how war can happen in such a precious place. It is most regrettable.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Enbarr's streets are paved with unhappy memories, Professor. I've avoided the damned place ever since I abandoned my nobility. Swore never to return. Now here we are. To return in this manner... Well, I can't say it is something I ever imagined.

speaker: Manuela
text: In the opera, actors came and went all the time. But the people behind the scenes would stay forever. I'll bet I'd know a few of them now, even after all these years.

speaker: Alois
text: Here we are, facing the final battle with the Empire. It's been a long, difficult struggle. We have to get Lady Rhea back! And we have to crush the Empire, in the name of Captain Jeralt. I don't know what comes next. But we can sort out those details later.

speaker: Catherine
text: Looks like we're nearing the end of this struggle. I'm sure Lady Rhea is on tenterhooks waiting for me to swoop in and rescue her.

speaker: Byleth
text: Probably.

speaker: Catherine
text: I was just kidding! Pay me no mind.

speaker: Byleth
text: I doubt it.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oof... You don't mince your words. Try being a bit more mindful of other people's feelings.

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea's not waiting for me, I know, no matter how much I might wish she were. She's waiting for you.

speaker: Shamir
text: Ten years ago, Dagda and Brigid attacked the Empire from the west. The final target was the capital. But they were countered at a port town, long before they reached their destination. I guess our attempt has been more successful than theirs, all things considered.

speaker: Cyril
text: Whenever I think about how we'll be seeing Lady Rhea real soon, I get happy and really get cleaning! We'll get there for sure, right? We'll see her again?

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll meet her for sure.

speaker: Byleth
text: We don't know for sure.

speaker: Cyril
text: I got gotta believe Lady Rhea is waiting for us in the capital... We just have to find her.

speaker: Balthus
text: Nader the Undefeated… With a name like that, he's bound to put up a damn-good fight. Did you get a good look at Judith? She practically had hearts floating out of her eyeballs when she looked at Nader.

speaker: Byleth
text: She must be in love.

speaker: Balthus
text: You saw it too? Heh, I know that look well. She's got it bad. Honestly, they'd make a cute couple.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not so sure about that.

speaker: Balthus
text: Pretty dense, aren't ya? Trust me, pal. No one's seen more heart-eyed women than this guy. She's got it bad.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's ridiculous.

speaker: Balthus
text: Pretty dense, aren't ya? Trust me, pal. No one's seen more heart-eyed women than this guy. She's got it bad.

speaker: Balthus
text: It makes all the sense. Even seasoned warriors aren't immune to love, pal.

speaker: Judith
text: That Nardel guy... or Nader, I suppose. It was all some trick, and we fell for it. Hmph. I don't think the nickname The Undefeated applies is he flees from us. Though... maybe he only got that name by running away. Can't be defeated if you run off, right?

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Momentum's really picking up for this final battle, huh? Even I'm starting to feel tense! Me! Enbarr's history goes back 1,400 years. That even predates the founding of the Empire. It's one of the sacred sites of the Seiros faith, so it's a pretty big deal. But hey, no need to worry about the monastery while you're fighting the final battle. I've got it covered! I'll defend it to my last!

speaker: Claude
text: There it is... Enbarr. The Imperial capital and the largest city in all of Fódlan.

speaker: Judith
text: It's not just big. This city was designed to protect the castle where the emperor lives. It's as though the city itself is a massive stronghold.

speaker: Byleth
text: And the citizens?

speaker: Byleth
text: What is the state of affairs in the town?

speaker: Claude
text: They surely noticed us approaching some time ago, and yet...

speaker: Shamir
text: Our scouts confirmed the citizens haven't been evacuated. They're being kept in town.

speaker: Claude
text: I've got to hand it to Her Imperial Majesty. Using her citizens as a shield to protect the castle takes some resolve.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I suspect those mages will be lurking within as well...

speaker: Shamir
text: Troops deployed to other areas are also returning.

speaker: Judith
text: If we don't conquer the city quickly, things will get complicated fast.

speaker: Byleth
text: I hope we find Rhea...

speaker: Seteth
text: We can't search until we conquer the city. Let's focus on the fight for now.

speaker: Cyril
text: Lady Rhea, please be safe.

speaker: Claude
text: We've kept the Empire waiting long enough. Onward!

speaker: Claude
text: We were told Hubert would be leading the enemy forces, but the Death Knight's also with them. We'll have to take care of both of them, but we won't have time to mop up all the enemy units. We'll have to split up and take them on at the same time, or risk being overrun by their reinforcements.

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: It's here! The Crest of Flames banner! There! On the other side of the canal!

speaker: Hubert
text: Uninvited guests, I see. Heh. Let's ensure they receive a warm welcome. Ready the artillery. Prepare to attack. Rocks, arrows, magic - rain death upon the enemy until they are silent as the grave. Reinforcements will fly in shortly. Defend the heavy weapons until they arrive.

speaker: Hubert
text: Our first wave of reinforcements is here. It will not be long until the next.

speaker: Claude
text: Reinforcements?! That was quick... We can't hang around or they'll just keep coming. We'll have to capture the artillery. We can turn them against their reinforcements...

speaker: Hubert
text: We have reinforcements coming in from another direction. Deploy them as soon as they arrive.

speaker: Claude
text: OK! Just Hubert left to deal with...

speaker: Hubert
text: We are taking heavy losses. We need more troops...

speaker: Claude
text: Well done, everyone! Now we can break through into Enbarr! We need to hurry up and attack the palace to block Edelgard's movements!

speaker: Claude
text: It's over, lapdog. Your military rule is at its end.

speaker: Hubert
text: For every step you take along that path, our thorns will cut into your heels.

speaker: Claude
text: Ooh, that sounds painful. I'll have to wear thicker soles for the march.

speaker: Hubert
text: If your boots are too heavy, you won't be able to lift your feet. But enough prattle.

speaker: Seteth
text: You will not escape, Death Knight. Today you will be unmasked!

speaker: Death Knight
text: My true identity has no value.

speaker: Seteth
text: I will be the judge of that, once I've seen your face.

speaker: Flayn
text: So it's you, Death Knight! Remember me?!

speaker: Death Knight
text: You again. Here to lose more blood?

speaker: Flayn
text: Never! You will not lay a hand on me ever again!

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, how long's it been? Five years? Who'd have thought you'd end up an Imperial general...

speaker: Death Knight
text: So, you wish to die.

speaker: Claude
text: Heh. As antisocial and unhinged as ever, I see.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I came here to get you! Let's return together, Emile!

speaker: Death Knight
text: Leave! The place of your death is not here!

speaker: Claude
text: We've made it this far... Somehow. Edelgard is probably looking down on us from somewhere in that castle.

speaker: Leonie
text: I wonder if she's panicking or just smiling smugly...

speaker: Claude
text: From this point on, she'll be giving it her all too. Expect her to be tougher than the last time we fought. This battle will settle things once and for all. We'll attack as soon as everyone is ready.

speaker: Claude
text: Huh? Is that you, Dedue?!

speaker: Dedue
text: I heard the Alliance's army has entered the city. I've been searching for you ever since.

speaker: Byleth
text: How long have you been in Enbarr?

speaker: Dedue
text: I arrived not long after the battle at Gronder Field. I am here to kill Edelgard.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you doing in Enbarr?

speaker: Dedue
text: I'm waiting for a chance to kill Edelgard. I have not yet been blessed with the opportunity.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, if you want to fight alongside us, we'd be more than happy to have you.

speaker: Dedue
text: We fight for different objectives. I swore to offer Edelgard's head to His Highness. But... Should I fail, I will have no choice but to entrust that mission to you. This is the information I have gathered during my time in hiding here. It includes details about the inside of the castle.

speaker: Claude
text: I appreciate this, but... What do you plan to do? Don't tell me you plan to do alone?

speaker: Dedue
text: I've done what I came here to do. Farewell.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey! Wait! He's gone. He's just as hard to understand as his liege was.

speaker: Claude
text: The time has finally come, my friend. Once we win this fight, the Empire will fall...

speaker: Byleth
text: What will become of Fódlan?

speaker: Claude
text: What will become of it? Well, that's for us to decide, isn't it?

speaker: Byleth
text: What will we do about Fódlan?

speaker: Claude
text: The subject is heavy on my mind.

speaker: Claude
text: Odd as it sounds, I believe the forces responsible for destroying Fódlan are also responsible for protecting the livelihood of its citizens. Everything, even the land itself, has been harmed by the chaos of war. Restoring it will be no easy feat. To do that, the first thing we need to think about is a new ruling system for all of Fódlan.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Alliance lords could divide the territory.

speaker: Claude
text: No, I don't think that would work. The western half of the continent has little connection to the Alliance. Any attempt to force dominion on them would breed rebellion. The world would slide back into war once again.

speaker: Byleth
text: We could unify Fódlan as one nation.

speaker: Claude
text: As usual, we're on the same page. I was thinking the same thing.

speaker: Claude
text: Even if the Alliance lords and any remaining influential nobles were to divide up dominion of all of Fódlan... They would simply pursue their own interests. Another war would be inevitable. That's why there needs to be a powerful ruler who stands above them all and unifies Fódlan as one nation.

speaker: Byleth
text: You should be that ruler, Claude.

speaker: Claude
text: If it means I can lead Fódlan to a better future, I wouldn't mind that at all.

speaker: Byleth
text: We must search for a new ruler.

speaker: Claude
text: A new ruler, huh? I think I've got someone in mind.

speaker: Byleth
text: I should be that ruler.

speaker: Claude
text: My friend... Do you really mean that?

speaker: Claude
text: My dreams await in a future where Fódlan is no longer ravaged by war. There are things I want to see with you some day. I'll keep thinking about the best way to achieve that goal. Whatever we decide to do, we can't do it until we defeat the Empire. Fódlan can't welcome a new dawn until we win the war. Let's prepare as best we can.

speaker: Claude
text: Good work, Hilda! You didn't do much manual labor, but you managed to rope the knights into helping us restore the monastery.

speaker: Hilda
text: Thanks, Claude, but all I did was piggyback on your scheme. I saw your eyes telling me to make some magic happen!

speaker: Alois
text: Thank you so much for your help with the restoration.

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh please, it was nothing! We're just doing our part as former students.

speaker: Catherine
text: I'm told you even routed the bandits. That job should have fallen to us. I'm sorry for the trouble.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, don't think twice about it. We're all allies in the resistance against the Empire, right?

speaker: Catherine
text: The church is at war with the Empire, but let's be realistic. Wouldn't it be better for the Alliance to eventually submit?

speaker: Claude
text: The way I see it, the emperor wants to take over all of Fódlan and destroy the existing order of the world. I can't see her allowing the Alliance to continue to exist. We're in this just as deeply as you are. Actually… We were hoping to use this place as a base. The Empire begs to be meddled with, and we're first in line.

speaker: Alois
text: What? Why would you want to make your base here of all places?

speaker: Claude
text: Garreg Mach is situated in the center of Fódlan, both geographically and spiritually. We want to secure this location while the Empire is still overlooking it.

speaker: Catherine
text: I see. The Empire doesn't see this place as important at the moment because it's far from the front lines.

speaker: Claude
text: But if we simply decide that it's ours to occupy, that does nothing to inspire the hearts and minds of the people of Fódlan. Luckily, good ol' Teach has finally returned to us. If the Professor Rhea entrusted with the Sword of the Creator fights at our side… Well now. That's a just cause anyone could get behind. What's more, here we are, working alongside the legendary Knights of Seiros. It smacks of divine providence, doesn't it? Can you feel it?

speaker: Seteth
text: I have heard what you have to say, Claude. And you, Professor? Where do you stand?

speaker: Byleth
text: I will fight the Empire.

speaker: Seteth
text: Hm. On our own, we lack sufficient military strength. But with the help of the Alliance…

speaker: Byleth
text: I will find Rhea.

speaker: Seteth
text: Hm. We are at a relative standstill, but with the help of the Alliance…

speaker: Seteth
text: The archbishop said if anything should happen to her, that we should entrust the affairs of the church to you. If you intend to fight alongside the Alliance, then I will follow you as well. Is that acceptable, Claude?

speaker: Claude
text: Of course. I can't think of anything more reassuring than having both Teach and the knights on our side. Together, we'll stop the emperor and her reckless ambitions!

speaker: Claude
text: Hey there, my friend. It's funny how the monastery was once in ruins, but now it's downright bustling. Thanks to a little promise five years ago, our buddies have all gathered, and even the knights have returned. It's like we were all just waiting for you to awaken. And now we're all going to band together against the Imperial army. You should go and talk to everyone, if you can. There may be some who are still on the fence.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I have written to my father to signal my intention to remain here. Not that I require his approval to do so. There is not much for me to gain by returning to Alliance territory now. But by staying, I will be able to influence the course of events directly, on the field of battle.

speaker: Byleth
text: Will you get along with the Alliance leader?

speaker: Lorenz
text: We will not be friends, but I will cooperate with him as much as is necessary to secure victory.

speaker: Byleth
text: Will you keep an eye on the Alliance leader?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Naturally. Someone needs to make certain he does not lead the Alliance to ruin.

speaker: Raphael
text: Fighting alongside you and everyone else is a dream come true, Professor! And don't worry about my little sis. Right now she's back home helping out with the family business. I kinda figured I was gonna be stuck going back and taking over for her. But thanks to you and Claude, I get to work on my dream of becoming a proper knight!

speaker: Ignatz
text: It's been fixed up quite a bit, but it's battle scars aren't so easily erased... To think that a glorious cathedral, with a thousand year history... would end up like this. I'll rebuild this place someday. This cathedral is the symbol of Fódlan. Maybe I should paint a picture of the beautiful cathedral of old, while I still remember what it looked like...

speaker: Lysithea
text: I've grown weary and impatient - these past five years, my hands have been bound. But now, I can finally take action with a clear goal. I'm grateful to you and to everyone.

speaker: Byleth
text: I didn't do anything.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Nonsense. Your presence steeled everyone's resolve.

speaker: Byleth
text: And that goal is?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Down with the Empire! Surely peace will soon follow if the Empire is overthrown. Then my parents can finally find peace themselves.

speaker: Marianne
text: Even with the church in shambles, we can still pray. The goddess will surely hear our prayers, but still... I hope the church can return to it's former beauty someday.

speaker: Hilda
text: I'm pretty headstrong, but Claude could give me a run for my money. I mean, he's dragged the knights into this. You ought to be careful, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll be fine.

speaker: Hilda
text: I wonder if you've got a hidden headstrong side? You must be hiding it really well though.

speaker: Byleth
text: You too.

speaker: Hilda
text: Don't worry about me. I'm here because I want to be. Also because being around my big brother feels like a real chore.

speaker: Leonie
text: It's not just for my village that I'm fighting alongside you here, you know. It's also that Captain Jeralt asked me, his first and greatest apprentice, to look out for you. Of course, it wouldn't be enough just to keep you alive. It's my duty to make sure you win too. So do your best, Professor. And count on me to watch your back.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I have lost my dominion. My nobility may seem like nothing more than a title. But I will never lose my noble heart. I will stop Edelgard, even if it costs me my life. I have turned my blade against her now. I cannot go back on that decision. Professor… Do you think I chose the wrong path?

speaker: Byleth
text: Not at all.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll find out soon enough.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: You are right…

speaker: Linhardt
text: The promise was made five years ago, but I must say I'm rather surprised how many of us managed to make it. Personally, I only showed up because I hoped to see you again, Professor. I've been with my family in the Empire until recently. I admit to feeling a little guilty betraying Her Majesty...but only a little. Now that we're all together again, I suppose the fighting will begin soon.

speaker: Caspar
text: Hey, Professor! You won't believe what happened! I figured I couldn't go back to the Empire after Garreg Mach fell, so I started drifting across the Kingdom and Alliance. Then, I just happened to run into our old class, so we came back to the monastery together!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ah, at last, I return to my domain! My lonely paradise! My realm of exquisite Solitude! Huh? Professor? Is that, um. Is that you? You, um. You didn't hear that just now, did you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Sorry.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Oh! Forget you heard anything!

speaker: Byleth
text: Hear What?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Right. You didn't? Well, um. Good.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Laaa-la-laaa-la-laaa... Professor! Oh my! It's so good to see you. These days, so many old friends seem to be disappearing. But you... You're here! It's incredible to see you again after five years! I have a feeling your name will go down in history.

speaker: Petra
text: Edelgard is controlling the Empire. She is putting the pressure on the Kingdom and Alliance. Empire and religion are at open war. It will be… difficult for us at first. But corrupt nobles are many. That means the common people will rebel and be joining our side. With you, Professor, the battle tides will…ah, will turn. I have certainty.

speaker: Felix
text: A country with no king has no future. That's why I made my way here. Professor, don't let me down.

speaker: Byleth
text: Country with no king?

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. You'll understand soon enough.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's forge ahead.

speaker: Felix
text: Yes, let's. Find me a worthy opponent to battle and I'll be content.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I'm the heir of House Gautier, and I'm fighting alongside a bunch of Alliance people? I can just imagine my father's face contorted in anger and the delightful words he must have used to describe me. I don't know how standing and fighting for Faerghus would have helped. Sorry, Professor. I don't regret my decisions. I'm just thinking out loud. And I'm hoping I haven't made a big mistake.

speaker: Mercedes
text: You're here, Professor, along with everyone from our old class. It's like we've gone back in time! When I think that I'll be around you again, all of my sorrows just drift away.

speaker: Byleth
text: Frankly, I don't feel too happy.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Hmm, I understand. Especially with Lady Rhea missing...It sounds like the Kingdom and Empire have been in a sorry state too. But we can't let that get us down!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's do our best together.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Hmm, yes. I'll at least try not to hold anyone back.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Let's work together for the common good, like we did five years ago!

speaker: Annette
text: Members of the knights tell me that Father left their ranks five years ago. They say he announced he was returning to the Kingdom, but nobody’s heard from him since. I haven’t received word that he went back to Mother… Where could he be… Where are you, Father…

speaker: Ingrid
text: Professor. I have a proposal. Why not go beyond the Knights of Seiros—instead, uniting with allies from all across Fódlan to fight for our cause? Looking back, it would have been best to ally with the Kingdom and join forces against the Empire. But now the Kingdom is not exactly… Well…

speaker: Seteth
text: Five long years, I've searched for you and the archbishop. It's a pleasure to see you again. The Church of Seiros will follow you from now on, but please do not abandon the search for Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll do whatever it takes to find her.

speaker: Seteth
text: Thank you. I know the battles ahead will be dire, but we will support you with all our strength.

speaker: Byleth
text: We don't know what the future will bring.

speaker: Seteth
text: Wherever she is, Rhea is doubtlessly waiting for you. Please do not let her down.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor, I am so glad you are unharmed! No matter the path you walk, I will be with you every step of the way. Anything you ask of me, I shall see it through. You saved my life, and I am in your debt.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Thankfully, it appears the records and equipment I need for my research have not been damaged. I am most curious though. You say you were asleep for five whole years? Incredible. Perhaps this is another effect of your Crest. I do look forward to investigating you in greater detail.

speaker: Byleth
text: We can talk about that.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Wonderful news! I am most excited to begin. We must find the time, of course.

speaker: Byleth
text: Uh, maybe later...

speaker: Hanneman
text: I'll have to be content with observing you wherever you go, then. I cannot waste any opportunity!

speaker: Manuela
text: My, Professor. You haven't changed a bit! At your age, I'd expect your whole demeanor to have changed greatly over five years... Though I suppose I haven't changed either, right? Thank you for noticing, by the way. Ah, Just the two of us, forever young. Oh, let me have my fun.

speaker: Alois
text: I'd given up on ever seeing you again. Where have you been hiding? Anyway, now that we're reunited in the land of the living, I must fulfill my promise!

speaker: Byleth
text: What promise?

speaker: Alois
text: The promise I made to the captain! to keep you safe! I can't believe you've forgotten. How cold...

speaker: Byleth
text: Right, the Promise.

speaker: Alois
text: That's right! I promised the captain I'd protect you in his stead, and now I'll make good on my word!

speaker: Catherine
text: In Lady Rhea's absence, I will follow you. That's what she would want me to do. Know that wherever you might lead us, I'll continue searching for Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's fine.

speaker: Catherine
text: Good, because I will not budge on that point. Welcome back, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: Sounds like a lot of trouble.

speaker: Catherine
text: I don't care how much trouble it is! I will rescue Lady Rhea, at all costs.

speaker: Shamir
text: I'm more of a mercenary than a knight these days. I work to get paid. I never was too attached to Fódlan. I was considering leaving soon... But I might change my mind if you're around.

speaker: Cyril
text: I don't know anything about rebuilding, but I can sure do my best to clean up the mess. I'm gonna keep Lady Rhea's room spotless, so she can use it right away whenever she gets back. You gotta find her, Professor. You just gotta.

speaker: Anna
text: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! You know, it's such a thrill to be able to greet you like this again! I almost died as well in the battle five years ago, but I won't allow any enemies to get into this place again, I promise you that! Even if the Death Knight shows up, I'll be sure to... Well, for now I'll keep training so I can eventually feel confident that I can stop him!

speaker: Claude
text: Everyone, listen up! I have a proposal. We are now building our forces in order to rise up against the Imperial army. But it wouldn't be smart for us to fight under the banner of the Alliance. That would only incite the lords who support the Empire. We've also combined forces with the Knights of Seiros. Therefore, I suggest that we operate under a new symbol. That's why I've prepared this...

speaker: Claude
text: You may recognize it as the Crest of Flames, which resides in Teach. The phantom Crest that has reappeared after more than 1,000 years. We're attempting our own miracle, so it seems like a suitable symbol for us. So... Until we welcome the dawn of a new age in Fódlan... Let's fight to the very end, as one, under the symbol of the Crest of Flames!

speaker: Hilda
text: Impressive, Claude. Forget restoring the monastery. You've somehow roped everyone into fighting back against the Empire!

speaker: Claude
text: If you recall, I never asked anyone to join us. If anything, we have Teach's achievements to thank. Now that you mention it, I guess I should express my gratitude.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, friend. So this is where you've been. Without you, the knights never would have joined our cause. I could never pay you back for that.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're welcome.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's do our best.

speaker: Claude
text: Just leave it to me, Teach. When this fight is over, I plan to see all of my dreams come to fruition, and yours as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you dreams, Claude?

speaker: Claude
text: Well, for example... to bust open Fódlan's Throat. There's a massive fortress there, which is responsible for protecting the eastern border of the Alliance. I like to think of it as a lid on a bottle. The people of Fódlan only know a small part of the world. Their prejudices are born because they don't know what lies beyond their borders. And the opposite is true too. Those outside of Fódlan don't know about this place. Ignorance breeds discrimination. Whether you look inside the bottle or outside of it... If you really look, all you find are people who you can get along with, if you only try. That's why I wanna bust open that lid, which is keeping us locked inside. Or destroy the bottle entirely.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you going to tell our allies about this?

speaker: Claude
text: I'll find the right time to bring it up. Even if I talked about it now, it doesn't seem realistic, does it? First we need to defeat the Empire and restore peace to... Huh?

speaker: Leonie
text: Professor! Claude! We're under attack!

speaker: Claude
text: I guess we'll have to cut our conversation short. What's going on, Leonie?

speaker: Leonie
text: It's a small group, but some Imperial troops are headed this way. It looks like they were stationed nearby.

speaker: Claude
text: I got to hand it to Edelgard. Nothing gets past that woman.

speaker: Byleth
text: We should proceed cautiously.

speaker: Claude
text: As long as we don't let our guard down, there's no way they can defeat us.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's take them down.

speaker: Leonie
text: All right! I'll show you how much I've improved, Professor!

speaker: Claude
text: This will be our first battle alongside the Knights of Seiros. Let's kick off our new partnership with a magnificent victory!

speaker: Randolph
text: The Knights of Seiros are a powerful enemy, but we have more soldiers. We'll take them down all at once!

speaker: Claude
text: So, the enemy intends to use their overwhelming numbers to defeat us. Let's fight fire with... actual fire.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Report! The enemy has entered the periphery of Garreg Mach!

speaker: Claude
text: If they reach the interior, the enemy will take the monastery. Drive them back immediately!

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: What? That strange battle flag is... But isn't our enemy the Church of Seiros?

speaker: Randolph
text: They didn't have enough soldiers with just the church, so they upped their numbers by joining with those filthy rogues. It doesn't matter what flag they fly. They're nothing more than a mob. We'll destroy them all!

speaker: Claude
text: Allied soldiers are making preparations for the plan. Protect them!

speaker: Claude
text: What? The fire attack unit was routed?! Damn it...my brilliant plan failed.

speaker: Randolph
text: It looks like they were planning something, but it failed!

speaker: Claude
text: We're prepared for the fire attack. Now we just need to draw the enemy's attention. You can't defeat us with that many soldiers? The Imperial army is doomed without a capable general!

speaker: Randolph
text: Quiet! Don't think you'll get away with mocking me! Attack! Make sure they never speak again!

speaker: Claude
text: Now!

speaker: Randolph
text: Argh, a fire attack... The damage is too great. We can't fight anymore! All units, retreat! I'll take on our pursuers! Carry away the injured soldiers!

speaker: Claude
text: If we let them escape, they'll come back to attack later. We have to take them out!

speaker: Randolph
text: A total loss... But we can't just return home like this...

speaker: Claude
text: Teach, look out! They're after your head!

speaker: Claude
text: Phew! Nice work. We won without much incident, thanks to all of you.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: I don't think the Empire will leave us alone now. What do you plan to do?

speaker: Claude
text: I intend to ask the Alliance lords to share some troops with us to bolster our forces.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I will speak plainly. No matter whom we beseech for reinforcements, our envoys will inevitably pass through Gloucester territory. My father is being cautious not to give the Empire a pretext to intervene. Therefore, he is unlikely to allow even envoys to pass through.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why not request reinforcements from the Kingdom?

speaker: Claude
text: Ah... I guess I haven't told you yet, Teach. The Kingdom isn't in a position to be sending anyone reinforcements. After losing King Lambert during the Tragedy of Duscur, a Regent had been handling it's politics. But then... There was a bloody coup. The Regent and Prince Dimitri both... Apparently the whole family was killed. All Blaiddyd territory, including the Kingdom capital, is being ruled by those who are cooperating with the Empire. The Kingdom is no more. It's not called the Faerghus Dukedom. The vast majority of the former Kingdom lords bent a knee to the overwhelming power of the Empire and the Dukedom, and now fall under their jurisdiction.

speaker: Claude
text: Some who formerly held power are continuing to resist, but it would be difficult for them to regain it.

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh, hey! I can think of one person who we can ask for reinforcements. Someone whose territory is really close, and who's on good terms with Claude...

speaker: Lysithea
text: Ah! The Hero of Daphnel, I presume?

speaker: Leonie
text: I've seen her before, and she does seem to be reliable.

speaker: Marianne
text: You're talking about Judith, right? I bet she would lend us a hand...

speaker: Byleth
text: She seems intimidating.

speaker: Byleth
text: She seems strong.

speaker: Claude
text: That's right, you've met her once before, Teach. She's a fearsome one-woman army. She did a lot for me, even before I was recognized as the heir to House Riegan. I don't like the idea of owing her more than I already do, but given the situation, sacrifices must be made. I'll reach out to her. As for the rest of you, prepare for our next battle.

speaker: Claude
text: Heya, Teach. How are you feeling? Does anything feel, um... strange at all?

speaker: Byleth
text: Nothing in particular.

speaker: Claude
text: Good. I still vividly remember you suddenly collapsing and passing out after you went through those changes. But maybe that's not a concern now that you've spent five long years napping.

speaker: Byleth
text: I feel a bit sluggish.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, you were asleep for five whole years, after all. It'll probably take time to get you back to top form. Though I'm relieved to see you haven't lost a step as far as combat goes.

speaker: Claude
text: Your command bringing my schemes to life... That's just how we fight best.

speaker: Byleth
text: Any word from Judith?

speaker: Claude
text: Not yet, but there's no need to worry. That woman adores me. Once we've bolstered our forces, it'll finally be time to start taking decisive action. But I wonder... Do you really think Rhea is still alive?

speaker: Byleth
text: She's alive.

speaker: Claude
text: I think so too. It's hard to imagine the death of someone as important as her staying a secret.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Claude
text: There's no telling. But it's also hard to imagine the death of someone as important as her staying a secret.

speaker: Claude
text: I wonder where she is and what she's doing...

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you hope she's alive?

speaker: Claude
text: All I know is that I still have a lot of questions I need to ask her.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you hope she's dead?

speaker: Claude
text: That's a dangerous question, Teach. To be honest, I've given it a lot of thought. All I know is that I still have a lot of questions I need to ask her.

speaker: Claude
text: About the true history of Crest Stones and Heroes' Relics... and the truth behind the legend of Seiros and Nemesis. She has secrets. Too many of them for my comfort. Considering the state of the world... it's suspicious. You must be curious about what was done to you and what her plans were for you, right? And you never did learn about your mother, did you? None of our doubts will ever be clear unless we hear these answers from Rhea herself. In that sense, I absolutely hope Rhea is still alive. But as far as Fódlan goes, I do wonder what a world without Rhea would look like.

speaker: Byleth
text: A world without Rhea?

speaker: Claude
text: The majority of people in Fódlan believe in the Seiros faith that Rhea preaches. That's why they accept the noble system as if it were the only option, and refuse to associate with those who believe in anything else. That closed-minded philosophy is the reason why Fódlan's Throat is locked tight. But if you remove the archbishop who strictly advocates that doctrine, that world view is no longer absolute. There's room for free thought. The leadership of the church would undoubtedly fall to you, and you would hold the power to change the shape of the faith. Of the world. Then, for the first time, people would truly be free to think for themselves. To decide what's right, and what's wrong. Honestly, I believe Edelgard is probably hoping to achieve something very similar. But her methods require too much bloodshed. That's not something the world can get behind. Anyway... The best thing we can do is find Rhea and hear what she has to say. Heh, oops... I guess I've been going on for a while now. Sorry about that. You should get some rest.

speaker: Claude
text: Preparations are complete. Now it's a game of patience. As they say, good things come to those who wait.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Care to elaborate on this plan of yours, Claude? Can we really do this without battling my father?

speaker: Claude
text: Pretty soon, Count Gloucester will need to gather his troops in the northern part of his territory.

speaker: Byleth
text: Against the Kingdom?

speaker: Claude
text: The Kingdom has experience constant infighting since the coup. They're out of the picture for now.

speaker: Byleth
text: Against Houses Riegan and Daphnel?

speaker: Claude
text: You got it, Teach!

speaker: Judith
text: The combined forces of the Riegan and Daphnel houses will threaten the northern part of the Gloucester territory. Nardel, that retainer I mentioned, is going to draw their attention.

speaker: Claude
text: We'll take that opportunity to make our way through Gloucester territory and launch a surprise attack on the Great Bridge of Myrddin.

speaker: Lorenz
text: And...are you not concerned about the possibility that I may tip off my father?

speaker: Claude
text: The future of the Alliance rests on this battle. I'm certain you won't betray us.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Hmph. I will ensure our success.

speaker: Claude
text: I know you will. If we win this fight, then our next goal will be to topple Enbarr, the Imperial Capital. I said before that my plan was to meddle with the Empire, but I'm going to do you one better. We are going to defeat the Empire, once and for all. But to do that, we can't afford to slip up here. Bear that in mind and prepare yourselves for the coming battle.

speaker: Claude
text: If our plan succeeds, we'll arrive at the Great Bridge of Myrddin unscathed. The important part is what happens next. We're evenly matched in terms of military power, more or less, so if we can just launch a surprise attack...

speaker: Byleth
text: We have the advantage.

speaker: Claude
text: I wouldn't be so sure. That bridge is almost like a fortress. The defense there is rock solid.

speaker: Byleth
text: It could go either way.

speaker: Claude
text: Agreed. The bridge is basically a fortress, so the defense will be rock solid.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll still be at a disadvantage.

speaker: Claude
text: I'll give you that the bridge is basically a fortress. I wouldn't say we're at a loss, but we certainly shouldn't rest easy.

speaker: Claude
text: But that's why you're here, Teach! No matter the odds, you're the wild card we need to win!

speaker: Lorenz
text: I would like to believe that I have always made my own decisions. Even so, I cannot deny that some small part of me has always been aware of my father's wishes. Now, here I am. Concealing our plan - Claude's plan - from his sight.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you having second thoughts?

speaker: Lorenz
text: No. The strategy is sound, and I've consented to it.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're not reluctant, though, are you?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Quite the contrary, honestly. I feel as though a fog has finally lifted from my eyes.

speaker: Lorenz
text: In this fight, I will finally stand upon my own two feet, independent of my father's influence.

speaker: Raphael
text: Thanks to all that food from Judith, I'm full for once! I've got so much energy! Let me at that Great Bridge of Myrddin! I'll bust it down myself! Oh, but then how do we cross?

speaker: Ignatz
text: The Great Bride of Myrddin isn't just a bridge. It has the features of a fortress. I believe it was built for military purposes by the first leader of the Adrestian Empire. In other words, it's even older than the monastery. So if we occupy the Great Bridge, we'll have to search it from top to bottom.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I'm sure you know this already, but House Ordelia is aligned with the Empire. They face the Empire from across a river, similar to the Gloucesters. Even so, I refuse to yield to the Empire a second time. The Empire did unthinkable things to my family. And to me. The only option here is winning. Professor, you must promise we will overcome the Empire.

speaker: Marianne
text: Legend says that pillars of light fell and ravaged Ailell. I was reminded of that when I saw it... Um, Professor? Do you think those legends are true?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's likely.

speaker: Marianne
text: I think so too. I don't know if the goddess really destroyed the valley out of anger, but...

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes, and it'll likely happen again.

speaker: Marianne
text: Oh! I suppose you may be right. There's no way to be sure it won't...

speaker: Marianne
text: There's still so many things we don't understand in this world.

speaker: Hilda
text: It looks like people are slowly starting to come back to the town. I guess they feel safe now that you and the Knights of Seiros have returned. Peddlers have become more common too, so there'll be food and supplies available. After being run-down for all those years, it's really becoming livable again!

speaker: Leonie
text: Things have gotten a lot more interesting since we've joined up with Judith, haven't they? Anyone who casually treats Claude like he's just some kid is not a person to be trifled with. I think Captain Jeralt would have liked her. I hope someday I can be as strong, kind, and levelheaded as her.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: What used to be Aegir territory lies far to the east of the Great Bridge of Myrddin, downstream of the Airmid River. For the sake of my family, I wish we could invade the Empire from there. But I do not have the power to advocate for that. Strategically, Myrddin is more important.

speaker: Byleth
text: Someday, we'll take it back.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Thank you, Professor. I will not give in. Not until I have restored my noble pride!

speaker: Byleth
text: Taking it back would be difficult.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Yes, I know it would be difficult, but I will not give in!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Since I'm originally from the Empire, it seems no one trusts me with any important tasks. Fine by me. Honestly, I'd bet they're watching my every move to make sure I can be trusted.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sure they're not...

speaker: Linhardt
text: If I were leading the Alliance, it's what I would do.

speaker: Byleth
text: Probably.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I knew it. War makes people crazy, huh?

speaker: Caspar
text: The Airmid River separates the Empire and Alliance. It's the largest river in Fódlan. Sometimes it'll flood when there's lots of rain, but... At least the land gets some extra water!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: War isn't kind to you if you're a recluse. By the time you realize what's going on, you're already under attack. And if you're off by yourself, you can get killed with no one ever even finding out.

speaker: Byleth
text: Sounds like you're learning.

speaker: Byleth
text: Isn't that a little pessimistic?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Oh, that'd be awful—just terrible! OK, Professor, I get it. I know I'll have to come out.

speaker: Dorothea
text: We're going to invade the Empire...which means we'll be fighting people we know, won't we? If we're attacked by someone we know, or used to think of as a friend, it is permitted to run away?

speaker: Byleth
text: No, it's not OK.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Makes sense. A commander running away would be terrible for morale.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wouldn't blame you.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Really? If something happens, will you keep me safe?

speaker: Petra
text: If we can suppress this Myrddin, we can invade into the Empire, right? I was in the Empire. Now I will be an enemy... I am having strange feelings. It is with ease that an ally turns into an enemy...

speaker: Felix
text: We can predict what the Empire will do. Faerghus is our real problem. The eastern lords have joined forces and are warring with the Dukedom. But I've heard nothing about that conflict as of late. It's strange. I haven't heard much from my father either. I can't help but find this silence unsettling...

speaker: Ashe
text: It's thanks to you that I'm here now. I owe you, Professor. You saved my life. I swear I'll do all I can to repay that debt.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I had an encounter with Lord Gwendal... How many years ago was it? Back before the academy, I met this girl who I fell madly in love with...and her dad tried to kill me. I suppose he just tried to scare me, but I was sure I was going to die. Oh yeah, her dad? Lord Gwendal. Crazy, right? I never thought I'd seriously be trying to kill the guy in battle. I kind of don't know how to make sense of it.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Lady Rhea is in the Empire, isn't she? We should hurry up and find her. So many people in the monastery and nearby towns are worried...I want to ease their minds as soon as possible, Professor. Let's work together to find her!

speaker: Annette
text: Next we face the Great Bridge of Myrddin... We actually crossed it a long time ago. Do you remember? It was five whole years ago!

speaker: Byleth
text: During the Battle of the Eagle and Lion?

speaker: Annette
text: It seems like so long ago, doesn't it? It's odd how fast time flies...

speaker: Byleth
text: When we went to Remire Village?

speaker: Annette
text: What are you talking about, Professor? It was on the way to the Battle of the Eagle and Lion!

speaker: Annette
text: Everyone was still friends then. After the fighting, we all ate together without splitting into our separate houses. But now we're fighting the same people who were our friends back then... Even Ashe... I often wish we could go back to those peaceful days...

speaker: Ingrid
text: So, that was Judith. Just as I’d heard of her, she was an upstanding person. The same Daphnel blood runs through my veins, and yet I feel as though I am nothing like her. I am a phantom of what could be…

speaker: Byleth
text: You're actually quite alike.

speaker: Ingrid
text: You think so? Wow, thank you!

speaker: Byleth
text: True, you do differ.

speaker: Ingrid
text: If only I could be half of who she is.

speaker: Seteth
text: If Rhea really is in the Empire, then we must defeat the Imperial army by any means necessary. The people at large are just as concerned for Rhea's safety as we are. The sooner we can settle all our unease, the better.

speaker: Flayn
text: Judith is a wonderful person. So strong and confident, as well. Looking upon her, I am sharply reminded of my mother.

speaker: Byleth
text: Does she look similar?

speaker: Flayn
text: Not in the slightest. Rather, it is her way of being - her demeanor. Brilliantly bright and positive, like a warm ray of light.

speaker: Byleth
text: Does she act similar?

speaker: Flayn
text: Very much so! Both brilliantly bright and positive, like a warm ray of light.

speaker: Flayn
text: I... lost my mother, long ago. I miss her desperately.

speaker: Hanneman
text: The battle at Ailell was a tactical marvel. You grow stronger with each passing day. Where does your talent end and your Crest's power begin? Are they one and the same, I wonder? Most intriguing. Yet it is quite difficult to draw useful conclusions, given the situation. It is quite unfortunate I did not achieve my research goals before the war broke out. So much unknown. Now, I fear I will not have those answers even by conflict's end. So very frustrating.

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh, hello there, Professor. Did you need something from me? It doesn't look like you're wounded or anything. You just looking for... someone to talk to?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Manuela
text: I thought so. Well, I'm here for you! Making you feel better is my top priority.

speaker: Byleth
text: No.

speaker: Manuela
text: Come on now, you don't have to be shy. Helping you feel better is important to me.

speaker: Manuela
text: Whether it's physical pain or worries of the heart, you can come to me for anything, Professor.

speaker: Alois
text: So, Lady Rhea was in the Empire all this time. Glad as I am that Judith told us, I wish we had known this five years ago. We spent all that time spread out over Fódlan, searching for the archbishop and you. It was a mistake to abandon the monastery, to leave it in ruins. Now we're paying for that mistake.

speaker: Catherine
text: I'd heard of the Hero of Daphnel, but that was the first time I've met her in person. She's the head of a prestigious noble family? Just like Claude. The Alliance nobility is so... odd.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't think she acts like a noble?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it different in the Kingdom and Empire?

speaker: Catherine
text: Kind of, but I don't mean that in a bad way. You won't find such big-hearted nobles elsewhere. Plus, Judith can drink with the best of 'em! A woman after my own heart.

speaker: Shamir
text: Five years ago, when the Imperial army attacked Garreg Mach, they moved with incredible speed. But in the middle of all that chaos, she still had operatives watching. The Hero of Daphnel's spy network is impressive. She shouldn't be taken lightly.

speaker: Cyril
text: Is it true Lady Rhea was dragged off by the Imperial army? I heard that was true. Why'd they take Lady Rhea? Professor... they didn't take her to kill her, did they?

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Cyril
text: That's good. We just gotta beat the Imperial army and get her back, right?

speaker: Byleth
text: They probably haven't killed her.

speaker: Cyril
text: Yeah, good point. If they did, we'd have heard about it by now.

speaker: Cyril
text: You gotta help her, Professor. I'm begging ya.

speaker: Judith
text: I don't know where he recruited that man, but Claude's got an eye for great talent. I'm talking about his retainer, Nardel. I've only spoken with him briefly, but he seems to have a fair amount of both brains and brawn, with the skills to match. But there's something about him I can't quite place... Like I've somehow heard of him before...

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! I was talking to some of the Daphnel soldiers earlier, and it seems that Judith has a weakness. But they wouldn't tell me what it is! I got the feeling they didn't appreciate the question. Pardon me for being curious! That said, maybe keep this to yourself. Not that she terrifies me to my soul, but I'd hate to get on her bad side...

speaker: Lorenz
text: The Great Bridge of Myrddin is in sight. Beyond it, the Empire.

speaker: Cyril
text: Whaddya know. There aren't bridges that big in Almyra, that's for sure...

speaker: Lysithea
text: How unsettling. There are bridges in the southern part of Ordelia territory, but nothing like this.

speaker: Claude
text: It's the most strategic location in that area to move a large army across the Airmid River. The Empire will want to hold on to it at all costs, so expect tough defenses.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's finish this quickly.

speaker: Lysithea
text: You're right. The enemy's guard should be down, so let's end this quickly before they have a chance to retaliate.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's proceed with caution.

speaker: Ignatz
text: You're right. The defenses are pretty impenetrable. Let's make our move carefully.

speaker: Claude
text: You're in command, Teach. Do whatever it takes to win. Well, other than sacrificing the lives of our allies for the sake of victory. Try to avoid that. Let's get moving. We're counting on you, my friend.

speaker: Ladislava
text: That symbol... It's an enemy raid! Stay calm and face them head-on. Send a messenger to Acheron immediately! If we're quick, we might be able to pull off a pincer attack!

speaker: Claude
text: They say the enemy general, Ladislava, is among Edelgard's most trusted. Let's see what she's got.

speaker: Claude
text: Our goal is to take down Ladislava and gain control of the bridge. Let's go!

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: You think we'll let you take this bridge from us?

speaker: Claude
text: Whoa, new enemies from the central fortress? By the looks of it, that might not be all of them.

speaker: Ladislava
text: Acheron! Now's the time to show your loyalty to the Empire! Attack the enemy from behind!

speaker: Acheron
text: I've got to make my name known to her Majesty through distinguished service.

speaker: Claude
text: Acheron the Weathervane. He's of the Alliance. He's a minor noble who holds territory to the north of Myrddin. If he's gonna support the Empire, no need to hold back. He's nothing but a nuisance, even to the Alliance.

speaker: Claude
text: Looks like we can capture this fortress quickly if we take out the soldiers protecting it.

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Enemies approaching! Get the soldiers standing by to join the fight! We may need to hurry up preparations of the ballista too. Protect the fortress!

speaker: Alliance General
text: We'll ally ourselves with the Imperial soldiers too!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I will leave this area to the reinforcements, and then I will swing around to provide support from the south.

speaker: Claude
text: I'm glad we defeated them here... I doubt they're an enemy we could win against twice.

speaker: Acheron
text: The declining Alliance will be finished if I kill you. The Empire will herald the new age!

speaker: Claude
text: Only if you manage to kill me. Hm? What's that to the north? Looks like the home of another opportunistic noble is burning...

speaker: Acheron
text: That's... that's my castle! NO!

speaker: Claude
text: That's the declining Alliance at work, right there. Seems like you were facing the wrong way, Weathervane!

speaker: Claude
text: Well done, everyone. The Great Bridge of Myrddin is ours.

speaker: Leonie
text: I was prepared for bloodshed, but that was more than expected... I guess I'm still not used to this.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Even our enemies were fighting for their own cause. They held out without fleeing until the bitter end...

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't have to get used to it.

speaker: Leonie
text: That is true. I wouldn't want to become the type of person who feels nothing when someone dies.

speaker: Byleth
text: We must overcome this.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Yes... we can't afford to stall here.

speaker: Claude
text: Now it's on me to return to Alliance territory and convince those lords to join us. Lorenz, would you return home for the time being and lay the groundwork with your father?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Fine. After all, this is for the Alliance. Or rather, for all of Fódlan.

speaker: Claude
text: For those of you who live in Alliance territories, I ask that you return to your houses, and spread the word about the current situation. Until we finish our preparations, Judith and the knights will do everything in their power to defend the Great Bridge.

speaker: Judith
text: That's a casual way to dole out such a deadly mission, boy.

speaker: Claude
text: Do you object?

speaker: Judith
text: Just who do you think I am? I won't let the Empire pass this way, even if it costs me my life.

speaker: Claude
text: Too bad you're not allowed to die. Fight like your life depends on it, but flee if you're ever truly in danger.

speaker: Judith
text: A tall order, as always. I'll use my best discretion, Claude.

speaker: Seteth
text: We have no objections either. Go forth and secure us a sufficiently powerful army.

speaker: Raphael
text: I'll stay here too. The only ones I'd be going home to are my little sis and my grandpa.

speaker: Claude
text: Are you sure you don't want to see your sister? It may be a while before you can return home again.

speaker: Raphael
text: But if I see her, I may not want to come back. So I'll wait till I'm done here.

speaker: Byleth
text: What about me?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll stay here too.

speaker: Claude
text: Actually, I'd like for you to come with me, Teach. To help negotiate with the lords. They're followers of the Church of Seiros, after all. It'll make things easier if we have someone there to speak on Rhea's behalf. All right, everyone. Let's meet back at the monastery next month. Good luck out there.
Is that you, kiddo?

speaker: Claude
text: I have returned, Nardel.

speaker: Nardel
text: Oh, ah, Master Claude. It's you. I mistook you for one of the local children. My apologies.

speaker: Claude
text: It seems you have adjusted to your work here. Our recent strategy was successful, thanks to you.

speaker: Nardel
text: I was a bit concerned when House Goneril's army intervened from the east.

speaker: Claude
text: Count Gloucester must have requested reinforcements from them.

speaker: Nardel
text: Yes, and they have that young general who won some acclaim from his battles in Almyra... Regardless, they showed no signs of seriously wishing to attack us, and merely fulfilled their obligations to House Gloucester.

speaker: Nardel
text: Now then... who is this lovely lady?

speaker: Claude
text: This is my professor, who I asked to join me at the roundtable conference. Teach, this is Nardel, that retainer Judith was talking about.

speaker: Byleth
text: Nice to meet you.

speaker: Nardel
text: Hm, how polite. I've heard good things about you from Master Claude.

speaker: Nardel
text: You'll make me blush if you keep staring like that. Though I suppose people like me are something of a rarity here.

speaker: Claude
text: As you can see, he wasn't born in Fódlan. Still, trust me when I say he is highly capable.

speaker: Nardel
text: True. In fact, my capability is my only redeeming quality. I hope you'll continue to look after Master Claude, Professor.

speaker: Claude
text: Huh?

speaker: Claude
text: You overslept, Teach. Pretty rude to keep a fella waiting like that, wouldn't you say?

speaker: Claude
text: What's with that surprised look, my friend?

speaker: Claude
text: You didn't really think I'd given up — on you coming back, did you?

speaker: Claude
text: Can you feel it? A new dawn is finally here. Not just for us, though. No, for all of Fódlan.

speaker: Claude
text: It's been five long years. Where have you been, Teach? You don't really expect me to believe that you've been napping this whole time, do you?

speaker: Byleth
text: I was sleeping.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't remember.

speaker: Claude
text: That's a good one! Except… That's not your lying face. I guess I've got no choice but to believe you. You're not exactly normal to begin with, so it's not a huge stretch to imagine you sleeping for that long. Aaand this is where you say, just kidding. Right? If this is a rib, now's the time to fess up.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's the truth.

speaker: Claude
text: You must be insane. And yet… Fine. I believe you, OK? But that means you don't know anything that happened after your last battle, right?

speaker: Claude
text: I guess it's on me to catch you up. As you can see, Garreg Mach was crushed by the Empire and was never restored. The monastery is in ruins, and the town is in pretty bad shape too. Can you guess why?

speaker: Byleth
text: Rhea has been sleeping too?

speaker: Claude
text: Huh. It would seem that's one possible explanation, since you insist that's what you've been up to.

speaker: Byleth
text: Rhea has died?

speaker: Claude
text: Her body was never found, and the Empire never declared that she had been killed. So… No telling.

speaker: Claude
text: All we know for sure is that Rhea suddenly vanished during that battle five years ago. The Knights of Seiros have apparently been searching all over Fódlan for her… But the fact that this place is still in ruins tells me they still haven't found her.

speaker: Byleth
text: We must find her.

speaker: Claude
text: True. I've got a mountain of questions I'd like to ask her, after all.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm worried.

speaker: Claude
text: Worried, huh? Well, for better or worse, Rhea was clearly fond of you.

speaker: Claude
text: But I'm not so sure whether it would be good for her to return as the archbishop… Rather, with her gone… Eh, never mind. This could be a dangerous conversation. Before we discuss the state of affairs in each territory… Are you hungry? You must be. It's not much, but I did bring some food with me. Let's eat up and go from there.

speaker: Claude
text: Phew! I. Am. Stuffed. Even the most humble of meals tastes great with the right company. By the way, Teach, do you remember the night before the ball? I know it was five years ago… But we promised that the Golden Deer House would reunite during the millennium festival. Today's the day we promised to meet up… but no one's here.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's still early.

speaker: Claude
text: True… There's still some daylight left.

speaker: Byleth
text: They must not like us.

speaker: Claude
text: Heh, you know everyone looked up to you, right? Or is this your way of telling me I was a lousy house leader?

speaker: Claude
text: Let's just wait a little longer. You never know… Maybe someone will show up after all. Hey, Teach… Just waiting around sounds boring, so why don't we get in some exercise. You know, help with digestion and stuff. You must be in bad shape if you've been sleeping for five years. It'll do you good to get your body moving again.

speaker: Byleth
text: You want to work out?

speaker: Byleth
text: You want to play a game?

speaker: Claude
text: Something like that. Look, if you come with me, you'll understand. Oh, and don't forget your weapons, OK? I want to make sure neither your leadership nor your skill with a blade have dulled.

speaker: Claude
text: The thieves are here. Apparently they're trying to run off with treasures from the monastery.

speaker: Pallardó
text: What the… Intruders! Protect the goods!

speaker: Claude
text: This is gonna get expensive. Collect everything the thieves carried out!

speaker: Lorenz
text: The barbarity is even worse than the rumors. On my honor as a noble, I will expel these ruffians!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Today was supposed to be a happy day, but the monastery is in disrepair...

speaker: Hilda
text: Over there… Is that the professor? And the others?!

speaker: Leonie
text: Professor! You're alive! Guess we'd better handle this before I celebrate though, huh?

speaker: Claude
text: You finally made it! I guess virtue still exists in this crazy world after all.

speaker: Raphael
text: Is that the professor and everyone else? If they're fighting, I gotta go help!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Wow, it's you! Here I thought you were dead all this time.

speaker: Marianne
text: Could that be the Professor's…ghost?

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, you're late! Hurry up and help!

speaker: Claude
text: Hm, we could split into two groups. If we hit them from the north and south, we can trap their leader in a pincer attack.

speaker: Hilda
text: Professor! Boy am I glad to see you. How did we end up in this situation?

speaker: Ignatz
text: Professor, it's been too long! I do want to chat, but first let's handle these criminals.

speaker: Leonie
text: You've been alive all this time?! Where have you been hiding?! Never mind - talk later!

speaker: Lorenz
text: We have much to discuss. But first, let us dispense with the riffraff. It is a noble's duty, after all!

speaker: Lysithea
text: Ugh. The instant we arrive, we're neck deep in battle. We should've arrived late.

speaker: Marianne
text: P-Professor? Is it really you?

speaker: Raphael
text: Is that really you, Professor? It's been so long! I thought I'd never see you again!

speaker: Hilda
text: Ugh, I'm exhausted! What gives, Professor?

speaker: Lysithea
text: I was so excited to see everyone again, and then this happens…

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm still tired from the long journey. How did it come to this?

speaker: Ignatz
text: Let's all take a moment to catch our breath…

speaker: Hilda
text: If you've got the time to play with those guys, the least you could do is prepare some tea.

speaker: Byleth
text: Thanks for your help.

speaker: Claude
text: We were hoping someone would come to back us up when we started routing the bandits.

speaker: Byleth
text: Blame Claude.

speaker: Claude
text: Come on, those guys were thieves! We couldn't just let them get away.

speaker: Claude
text: It seems they've been taking advantage of the church's absence and doing whatever they please here.

speaker: Marianne
text: In any case, um… I'm glad that all of you are well.

speaker: Ignatz
text: That's the spirit, Marianne!

speaker: Raphael
text: That was fun! In fact, I wouldn't mind romping around some more!

speaker: Lorenz
text: So, you were alive this whole time, Professor. I am not surprised. In fact, that is why I came here.

speaker: Leonie
text: And it doesn't look like time has rusted your skills. That's a relief!

speaker: Claude
text: I'm just glad everyone's alive and well. On that note, let's move this reunion party somewhere else.

speaker: Claude
text: Now that we've dealt with those violent bandits, we could potentially use this place as our base of operations again.

speaker: Hilda
text: What could you possibly mean by that?

speaker: Claude
text: I'm talking about the Leicester Alliance taking over Garreg Mach Monastery. After all, it's right in the middle of Fódlan. It's a critical strategic location.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Are you suggesting that we fight back against the Empire?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Aren't you getting a bit ahead of yourself? The Alliance is in complete discord at present.

speaker: Claude
text: And as leader of the Imperial faction of the Alliance, isn't Count Gloucester, your father, the main cause of that discord?

speaker: Lorenz
text: I… Yes, that is true. It was inevitable. Our house's territory is close to Imperial land, after all. Had we not consented to vassalage under the Empire, they would have invaded immediately.

speaker: Claude
text: Naturally. And to be clear, I have no problem with your house maintaining its Imperial ties until we're sufficiently prepared to revolt. The Empire is the cause of the infighting.
