If we rid ourselves of them, the situation should resolve itself. That's why I'm thinking we should make this our base, raise up an army, and stir up some trouble for the Empire.

speaker: Raphael
text: Now you're talking! Sounds like fun!

speaker: Hilda
text: So then, Mr. Leader Man. Does this mean you intend to rope us into your little scheme?

speaker: Byleth
text: Leader Man?

speaker: Claude
text: Hm? Ah. My grandfather passed away. That means yours truly is officially the leader of the Alliance.

speaker: Lorenz
text: If we had a more reliable leader, perhaps the Alliance would not have been divided…

speaker: Claude
text: Think what you will. All I need to know is if you're in or you're out.

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm happy to lend a hand. I won't let those Imperial dogs set foot in Alliance territory! I couldn't bear it if my village got caught up in the chaos of war.

speaker: Raphael
text: I'll fight too! I've gotta protect my little sis!

speaker: Lysithea
text: I will join as well. After all, House Ordelia was once dragged into an Imperial revolt. It ruined us.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Ah, of course. I understand your motivation.

speaker: Ignatz
text: I'll fight too… It's time to take responsibility for my own future!

speaker: Marianne
text: I… I don't want to run anymore. I hope I'll be of use to everyone…

speaker: Ignatz
text: We can do anything if we work together, Marianne!

speaker: Hilda
text: What about you, Lorenz? Are you going to go back home to your scary father or what?

speaker: Lorenz
text: We cannot rely on Claude's scheming to lead us to victory. Therefore, I will remain. It is my duty to ensure Claude does not worsen the situation in the Alliance.

speaker: Claude
text: All of us are fighting for a different reason, but we share a common enemy. If we don't act, the Empire will crush us eventually. I say we stop them before they have the chance! So, Teach… Will you help as well?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'd rather search for Rhea than fight.

speaker: Claude
text: All the more reason to join us. Admit it. You're not going to be able to do much on your own.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll give it some thought.

speaker: Claude
text: Please do. I'm counting on you. Even if your ultimate goal is to find Rhea, it would be better to stick with us as you search.

speaker: Claude
text: With you on our side, the church will join us as well. That makes fighting the Empire a moral cause, which means it will be easier to rally support. Above all, your knowledge and strength are indispensable if we hope to stand a chance against the Imperial army. Without you, my schemes are nothing. Just words. Please… Take all of that into consideration as you decide.

speaker: Hilda
text: You're really laying it all on the table, aren't you, Claude? Well, all that aside, this place is a mess. We can't very well make our base in a ruin! And repairing it sounds like a lot of work… I wonder if anyone would be willing to help us out with that?

speaker: Seteth
text: Can it be?! You were alive all this time?!

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor! It is so good to see you again. My brother and I were worried about you.

speaker: Alois
text: Ah, thank the goddess… I couldn't bear the thought of letting Jeralt down by not finding you.

speaker: Shamir
text: Guess you lucked out.

speaker: Catherine
text: We've been looking everywhere for you! But…I see Lady Rhea isn't with you. Damn.

speaker: Cyril
text: Everyone was real worried about you, Professor.

speaker: Claude
text: Cyril? Is that you? You've grown up, kid. Have you been looking for Rhea with the knights?

speaker: Cyril
text: Of course. Without Lady Rhea, I don't belong anywhere.

speaker: Claude
text: Cyril, that's not… Never mind. We'll figure it all out.

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh my, the Golden Deer House is together again at last. And all grown up! Well, for the most part.

speaker: Hanneman
text: I do regret that we were never able to hold a proper graduation for all of you students.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why are you here?

speaker: Byleth
text: How is the search for Rhea progressing?

speaker: Seteth
text: It has been five years since Lady Rhea disappeared. We have devoted all of our energies to finding her. However, without being able to set foot in Empire territory, we are at a standstill. We had hoped that perhaps the archbishop would return here on this day…that of the long-awaited millennium festival.

speaker: Claude
text: Unfortunately, that doesn't seem to be the case. Though, I don't suppose you had very high hopes in that regard. Even if she were able to return here, with the monastery in ruins, I don't think she would have felt safe enough to do so. Right, Hilda?

speaker: Hilda
text: Yeah. This is an important location for the church. To think you've left it in such a state!

speaker: Byleth
text: The believers are mourning this destruction.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a danger to the locals too.

speaker: Alois
text: That's true… Perhaps we've left it alone for too long. We've got to make things right!

speaker: Cyril
text: I can clean this place up like new! It's not fit for Lady Rhea like this.

speaker: Catherine
text: And leaving this place in ruins affects the safety of this area too.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Agreed. There is also a great deal of valuable literature here.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Then let's do it! If we all work together, we can restore the monastery to its original beauty!

speaker: Seteth
text: We will require the aid of skilled craftsmen too. I shall seek out any such individuals who are willing to return to Garreg Mach.

speaker: Hilda
text: Fantastic! I'll figure out how to split up the work and then we can get started!

speaker: Claude
text: Is everyone ready? The objective of this battle is to defeat Edelgard and rescue Rhea. According to the information Dedue gave us, the throne room is directly north of the castle's main entrance. It's safe to assume that's where Edelgard is.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't want to kill Edelgard.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is there no way to walk the same path as Edelgard?

speaker: Claude
text: She's a fellow student to all of us. If there's a path that we can walk together, that would be preferable. But that all depends on Edelgard. If she won't yield, then that's that. If showing pity would put my allies in danger, I will not hesitate to kill her. I ask that you and everyone here prepare yourselves to do the same.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Understood. I think I speak for everyone when I say that we are prepared.

speaker: Lorenz
text: The future of the Alliance – no, of Fódlan – is at stake. I have been prepared for this my whole life.

speaker: Leonie
text: Captain Jeralt taught me that indecisiveness is a weakness. One must cast aside their doubts before fighting.

speaker: Flayn
text: The lives of Lady Rhea and everyone here are more important than all else. I shall be prepared.

speaker: Raphael
text: You know what? I wouldn't be surprised if she took one look at my overstuffed muscles and surrendered in tears, then and there!

speaker: Ignatz
text: I really hope that Edelgard will yield...

speaker: Hilda
text: Edelgard is a stubborn one. I don't think she's likely to surrender.

speaker: Marianne
text: Goddess... Please protect us...

speaker: Cyril
text: I...I'll fight with all I got to save Lady Rhea!

speaker: Seteth
text: Rescuing Lady Rhea is my dearest wish. We must prevail, no matter what it takes.

speaker: Alois
text: In the name of the Knights of Seiros, we'll bring the hammer down on the Imperial army!

speaker: Judith
text: Satisfied yet, boy? Everyone made up their minds a long time ago.

speaker: Claude
text: OK. Let's get started. We're yours to command, my friend.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leave it to me.

speaker: Claude
text: Everyone, take your positions! The battle is upon us!

speaker: Edelgard
text: They've made it into the palace, but it's actually the perfect chance to turn the tables on them. Defeating them all will turn the tide of war instantly. Taking a risk on dragging us back from the brink is the only option. Everyone! Prepare for a bitter struggle! Victory to the Adrestian Empire!

speaker: Claude
text: There are more enemies inside the palace than I thought. It's gonna take a lot to bring this situation under control. But, if we defeat Edelgard, then victory is ours! Everyone, let's go!

speaker: Claude
text: Our bashful little emperor has locked herself up behind the door of the throne room. The key should be around here somewhere. We need to find whoever's got it and take them out.

speaker: Petra
text: We must be protecting the throne room! You will not be getting past!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Stay back! I'll protect Edie with my life!

speaker: Claude
text: We'll have to take out one of them if we're going to advance... Petra seems like the shortest route...

speaker: Claude
text: I wonder how Dedue is doing... I hope I get to see him again.

speaker: Dedue
text: So close... Must press on...

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Infiltrators! Kill them!

speaker: Edelgard
text: I must confess I never imagined that you would be able to pursue me this far. I don't mean to belittle your skills, Professor, but you've far surpassed my expectations. Inform the troops! Destroy anyone who sets foot in the throne room!

speaker: Claude
text: We should be able to get through to the throne room now...

speaker: Claude
text: This should give us a bit more freedom of movement. Now, how best to attack...

speaker: Claude
text: We did it! The enemy won't be able to send any more reinforcements now.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Clever tactic. It's going to be difficult to turn the tables now.

speaker: Dedue
text: I cannot vanquish her alone. So I will join you in this battle. But if I fall, leave me. My only wish is for Edelgard's head.

speaker: Edelgard
text: So you're another of the goddess's vanguard. You don't have a shred of self-awareness, do you? Come at me, so that I may put you out of your misery!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor... I suppose you think you can defeat me. Is that right? But I will never give up. Even if my arms and legs failed me, I would still find a way to move forward. I will smash that false goddess and her minion into the ground! I will fight to free this world from her vile grasp!

speaker: Edelgard
text: This has nothing do to with where you were born. That we are fighting now is only a result of the choices you've made. So I'm going to give that the response it deserves. I will crush you with everything I have!

speaker: Claude
text: Edelgard, give up! We don't want to kill you!

speaker: Edelgard
text: But... I must kill you. If I don't, the righteous world I dream of will never see the light. Come at me with everything you have. For one of us, this is the end!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Your ideals, I understand they're not so far removed from my own. But without sufficient knowledge of this land's suffering, I can't entrust Fódlan to you!

speaker: Claude
text: Perhaps. I daresay it's true that I don't fully understand the history of Fódlan. Still, I've seen many things in my life. Don't worry. I'll finish the job for you.

speaker: Flayn
text: Edelgard! Please! Release Rhea... Release Fódlan!

speaker: Edelgard
text: If you strike me down, they will return. I cannot permit what you desire. You are a child of the goddess. You must not be allowed power over the people!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Lysithea. You and I are so alike. We could have walked the same path.

speaker: Lysithea
text: We're alike? You don't mean to tell me... It can't be!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yet now, we are at a crossroads. There's no turning back. Must we fight each other for the things we believe in?

speaker: Lysithea
text: That's exactly what's going to happen. And I will defeat you, Edelgard.

speaker: Seteth
text: Edelgard! Return Rhea! Release your grip on Fódlan!

speaker: Edelgard
text: If you strike me down, they will return. I cannot permit what you desire. You are a child of the goddess. You must not be allowed power over the people!

speaker: Edelgard
text: It looks as though... my path... will end here.

speaker: Edelgard
text: My teacher... claim your victory.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Strike me down. You must!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Even now... across this land, people are killing each other. If you do not act now, this conflict... will go on forever.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Your path... lies across my grave. It is time for you to find the courage to walk it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: If I must fall... let it be by your hand.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I wanted... to walk with you...

speaker: Claude
text: It's over. We were only able to beat her because of you.

speaker: Claude
text: This wasn't the conclusion I had hoped for. Even though... I... Never mind. It's over now. The important thing is that we won.

speaker: Judith
text: Here, boy. A letter. An Imperial general asked me to give it to you.

speaker: Claude
text: A letter? Let's see it.

speaker: Claude
text: It looks like it's from... Hubert. Edelgard's vassal.

speaker: Hubert
text: If you are reading this letter, that means I have perished. As Her Majesty would never surrender to another, I can only assume she has fallen as well. It greatly pains me to think of this coming to pass... That said, as the survivors, I must ask you to settle certain affairs in our stead. You must destroy the threat that slithers in the dark. I am sure you must recall Monica and Tomas. Their allies yet live. They hold deep resentment against the children of the goddess and the people of the world, and they are biding their time until they can exact revenge. If left to their own devices, it is certain they will eventually bring unimaginable calamity and suffering to the world. I detected their sorcery when you took Fort Merceus. I have deduced the location of their stronghold, Shambhala. You will find its whereabouts enclosed. There is no question that they are the enemies of everyone in Fódlan. Do not allow yourselves to forget that. Lastly... While I cannot say she is in good health, the archbishop resides in a secret chamber in the Imperial palace. I have shared the location of the entrance to that secret chamber with the person to whom I have entrusted this letter. I believe that Her Majesty will be victorious... Even still, I must plan for her defeat as well. If you wish to lead this world, I challenge you to rise to the occasion and surpass my estimation of you. Such is your obligation as the victors... and the only fitting tribute to all that Lady Edelgard sacrificed.

speaker: Claude
text: Hubert... To leave a letter like this behind... You were a better man than I believed you to be. So, Rhea is alive. And the fight isn't over yet. Those who slither in the dark... It sounds like Fódlan will never know peace unless we defeat them.

speaker: Claude
text: The allies of Monica and Tomas... Well, we knew about them already. I think it's safe to assume this is the same group who used Lysithea for their blood experiments. And they were also responsible for the javelins of light that destroyed the fortress. But who are these children of the goddess, who they supposedly resent? There's just not enough information here. I don't suppose there's any chance of his idea of a prank... If so, wow. Good one. Hubert... Rather than writing a letter, you should have just told us before we fought...

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's ask Rhea about it.

speaker: Claude
text: Right. We still don't know for sure if this letter is telling the truth. Let's go find out.

speaker: Rhea
text: You... You have come to save me... Is this... Is this a dream? I have longed to see you again... all this time... Is it truly you?

speaker: Rhea
text: Claude... I can see you have grown into a reliable young man... Thank you for supporting the professor, and for rescuing me. Surely the protection of the goddess has-

speaker: Claude
text: Wait, Rhea. What do you know about the children of the goddess?

speaker: Rhea
text: Children of... What is this about?

speaker: Claude
text: Forgive my bluntness. Someone from the Empire filled us in on a few things. I know it must be painful for us to ask you difficult questions after such an arduous confinement. But we have no choice. We must defeat a secret enemy... Those who slither in the dark. Do you know about them?

speaker: Rhea
text: Those who slither in the dark...

speaker: Claude
text: Apparently, they resent the children of the goddess and the people of the world, and are planning something big. Something terrible.

speaker: Claude
text: They use blood for their wicked magic and are capable of dropping javelins of light from the sky, which are powerful enough to crush a fortress. If you can think of anything at all, please tell us now. We need to know as much as possible about these enemies in order to stop them.

speaker: Claude
text: This is the critical moment that will determine whether or not Fódlan falls! Can't you see that the time for secrets has passed?!

speaker: Rhea
text: It is true that there is a group of people who have slithered in the darkness and threatened the peace of Fódlan since ancient times. I am sure you have heard the stories of a man named Nemesis...

speaker: Byleth
text: The King of Liberation...

speaker: Byleth
text: The wielder of the Sword of the Creator...

speaker: Claude
text: Nemesis, the King of Liberation. He's the hero to whom the goddess gave the Sword of the Creator.

speaker: Rhea
text: Nemesis was originally the leader of a group of bandits. He plundered the Holy Tomb and stole the remains of the progenitor god. When Nemesis appeared in Zanado some time later, he already wielded the Sword of the Creator.

speaker: Byleth
text: In Zanado?

speaker: Claude
text: Zanado, the Red Canyon...

speaker: Byleth
text: How did he get the Sword of the Creator?

speaker: Claude
text: According to legend, the goddess gifted him the sword to fight against the evil gods.

speaker: Rhea
text: I do not know how Nemesis obtained the sword, or why he appeared in Zanado. But he used that sword to massacre the people there. The children of the progenitor god. From their corpses he gained even more power, and brought war to Fódlan...

speaker: Claude
text: That's completely different from what the legends tell us about Nemesis.

speaker: Rhea
text: A mere bandit like Nemesis would not have been capable of anything so monstrous on his own...

speaker: Claude
text: Aha! So Nemesis had accomplices. And those accomplices must have been those who slither in the dark. They used Nemesis! And this time they used the Imperial army to once again bring war to Fódlan! I finally get it... And I even understand why Edelgard was associating with them. Just as they were trying to use the Empire, the Empire was trying to use them. Rhea, there's still a mountain of things I need to ask you. And I will. But I'll leave all of that for another day. You must be weak after living in confinement for so long. Please rest for a while. My friend... Let's prepare for battle. We need to strike Shambhala as soon as possible.

speaker: Rhea
text: You must not allow Fódlan's bloody history... the Red Canyon Tragedy... to repeat itself...

speaker: Claude
text: Hm. It occurred to me that we never got an answer from Rhea about the children of the goddess.

speaker: Byleth
text: Aren't they the people of Zanado?

speaker: Claude
text: She did say that the people of the Red Canyon were the children of the progenitor god, so I suppose so. But those evil guys continue to plot their revenge even after the Red Canyon Tragedy. Does that mean some of the children of the goddess, or their descendants, are still alive?

speaker: Byleth
text: Rhea?

speaker: Claude
text: Could be. She was talking about what happened in Zanado as if she was there herself.

speaker: Byleth
text: Flayn?

speaker: Claude
text: If there's something special about her blood, we can't rule out the possibility.

speaker: Byleth
text: Me?

speaker: Claude
text: Huh. Maybe? Though I get the feeling you're something else altogether.

speaker: Claude
text: What are these children anyway? And how are they connected to the goddess? Bah! I almost disappeared into the bottomless swamp that is my mind. I thought that after we defeated the Empire, I'd be able to see that sight I long to see..

speaker: Byleth
text: What sight is that?

speaker: Claude
text: I've told you about my dreams before... I want to break down the wall separating Fódlan from the outside world. The sight I want to see lies beyond that. Honestly, it's a trivial thing to fixate on. Just people, gathered in their towns. Living our their lives together. Sometimes laughing. Sometimes fighting. But the people living there aren't just citizens of Fódlan. They are people from Dagda, Brigid, and even Duscur and Sreng. There could be people who were born in Almyra or countries even farther east there too.. All of those people living together, like it's nothing special at all. That's the sight I long to see. It's so simple, but still so far away... But this is no time for complaining. We need to focus on capturing Shambhala. Let's hurry up and gather everyone together.

speaker: Judith
text: So... you mean to tell me that Fódlan will fall to ruin if we leave those guys be?

speaker: Hilda
text: Um, if this map is reliable, their base is just south of my family's territory.

speaker: Lorenz
text: This story is a bit much to believe... And yet...

speaker: Leonie
text: It does ring true somehow.

speaker: Claude
text: Remember Monica, the one who killed Jeralt? And the old man who was masquerading as Tomas? They were their allies. And the Flame Emperor and the Death Knight were merely their pawns.

speaker: Flayn
text: The people who were after my blood?!

speaker: Lysithea
text: They were also the ones who used me to conduct their blood experiments...

speaker: Claude
text: As awful as it sounds, they're seemingly fond of using blood in their secret techniques.

speaker: Hilda
text: Eww! That's really gross! I could never be friends with someone like that.

speaker: Claude
text: I believe they were also responsible for the javelin of light that destroyed Fort Merceus.

speaker: Judith
text: Hold up, boy. Do you really think that we can win against such powerful foes?

speaker: Claude
text: I don't know. But we have to try, don't we?

speaker: Byleth
text: This is for Fódlan's future.

speaker: Hilda
text: We've really taken on something big. I wonder if our names will go down in history.

speaker: Lorenz
text: My heroic name? Passed down to future generations? Haha! A worthy cause indeed.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's our responsibility as the victors.

speaker: Hilda
text: Since Edelgard can't do it, I guess it falls to us.

speaker: Claude
text: They were trying to use the Imperial army to plunge Fódlan into war, but we nipped that in the bud. Now we just need to tear our their roots. And I know we have what it takes to do it.

speaker: Judith
text: Our objective is Enbarr, the Imperial Capital. But our greatest obstacle lies before that.

speaker: Ignatz
text: And what's what?

speaker: Judith
text: Fort Merceus. If we can't pass through, we won't be able to reach Enbarr.

speaker: Leonie
text: Fort Merceus... the Impregnable Fortress, or so it's called.

speaker: Ignatz
text: If I recall correctly, it's sometimes referred to as the Stubborn Old General.

speaker: Lysithea
text: It is a massive fortress that was constructed to protect the Imperial capital.

speaker: Shamir
text: The Imperial army we defeated has withdrawn to Enbarr. Fort Merceus should be short on soldiers for now.

speaker: Byleth
text: We should attack quickly.

speaker: Judith
text: Yes, it would be good to finish up here before more enemy reinforcements arrive.

speaker: Byleth
text: We should be careful.

speaker: Judith
text: It would be best to take it before enemy reinforcements arrive. Still, there's a reason it's been called impregnable.

speaker: Judith
text: The only real question is what our fearless leader intends to do...

speaker: Claude
text: Sorry for the delay, everyone. Those mewling lords kept me from leaving for quite some time.

speaker: Judith
text: So? Were you able to secure additional reinforcements?

speaker: Claude
text: It's gonna have to wait until next month. It doesn't look like they can afford to keep supporting us at present.

speaker: Judith
text: Then what should we do about Fort Merceus? Do you plan on waiting around?

speaker: Claude
text: No. If we wait until next month, the enemy will have bolstered their defenses. That said, the prevailing theory is that you need triple your enemies' forces to take a fortress with a frontal assault.

speaker: Leonie
text: Right, that's what we were taught at the academy. And this is Fort Merceus we're talking about. It's renowned for its strong defenses.

speaker: Claude
text: Our current army isn't nearly strong enough. Hmm... What to do...

speaker: Judith
text: Whatever you do, just don't ask us to scale those huge walls. We'd end up dead when they hurl rocks down at us.

speaker: Hilda
text: Yeah, no thanks! If only someone would open up the gates for us from the inside.

speaker: Claude
text: Unfortunately we don't have any spies in there. Wait a minute... I've got it! We sneak in, stir up confusion, and open the gates ourselves to let our allies in.

speaker: Hilda
text: Right! That's what I was saying all along!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Right. Nice one, Hilda. But how do you propose we go about sneaking in?

speaker: Hilda
text: Disguises? If we dress up like Imperial soldiers, maybe they'll think we're allies and let us in!

speaker: Leonie
text: Do you really think they'd just open the gates for us? I'd be pretty dumbfounded if that worked.

speaker: Claude
text: No, no - she's on to something. It's a good idea, Hilda. We just need to refine it a bit, and we'll be in there before we know it.

speaker: Hilda
text: Really? Go me!

speaker: Lorenz
text: What is your definition of refining the idea? I know your go-to strategy is nausea-inducing poison, but...

speaker: Raphael
text: Urgh! I maybe ate too much. My stomach hurts...

speaker: Lorenz
text: Raphael... Why are you eating meat during a war council?!

speaker: Judith
text: So, fearless leader, I'm guessing you're going to keep the crucial parts of your scheme under wraps until the time comes, aren't you?

speaker: Claude
text: You know me so well, Judith. Whether we like it or not, this war puts a damper on all of our spirits. What's wrong with trying to have a little fun every now and again? Just leave the details to me.

speaker: Claude
text: Each time we take a step forward, more blood is spilled… but by spilling that blood, we're able to take yet another step forward. War is always a cruel affair, but luckily we have each other to lean on. We've steeled our hearts. We won't be broken.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm glad we have such reliable allies.

speaker: Claude
text: I couldn't agree more. Without them, we could never have made it this far.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wonder if we're pushing them too hard.

speaker: Claude
text: If anyone's starting to feel the strain, I'm sure just hearing from you will reassure them. Please… do whatever you can to keep their morale up.

speaker: Claude
text: Oh, and about taking the fort… I'll need a tad more time to prepare our plan. It's called an impregnable fortress for a reason, after all. My contingencies need contingencies this time, or we might not pull it off.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Fort Merceus is old and strong. Its reputation for durability is equal to that of Arianrhod. Are we really going to leave this to Claude? With a plan concocted by Hilda, of all people?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm uneasy too.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I thought you might be, with how secretly that man devises his schemes.

speaker: Byleth
text: Have a little faith.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I would like to, but I am always troubled by how secretly that man devises his schemes.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Let us hope the end result is not too outlandish.

speaker: Raphael
text: You know when you work your muscles and they start screaming? That means you gotta be nice to them. If your muscles are hungry, you gotta feed them, and let them rest when they're tired.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't see how you'd do that.

speaker: Raphael
text: Whaddya mean, how? You just gotta eat and sleep! It's pretty obvious...

speaker: Byleth
text: You can tell how your muscles are feeling?

speaker: Raphael
text: Of course! If my muscles hurt, then I hurt. If they're hungry, well then I'm hungry too!

speaker: Raphael
text: What's with the confused face, Professor? You look like you don't get a word I'm saying!

speaker: Ignatz
text: The battle at Gronder Field was gruesome, wasn't it? But perhaps it's irresponsible to look away - to close our eyes to the horrors of war.

speaker: Byleth
text: I agree.

speaker: Ignatz
text: As survivors, we must ensure that all these lives were not lost in vain. We must see the tragic foundations upon which we'll build our future.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't have to force yourself.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Thank you. But I think I do actually. As survivors, we must ensure that all these lives were not lost in vain. We must see the tragic foundations upon which we'll build our future.

speaker: Ignatz
text: May an age of peace rise from the ashes, so that all this sacrifice means something.

speaker: Lysithea
text: As I suspected, they seem to be supporting the Imperial army now. Thought I don't quite know who they are yet… Nor do I know what tricks they'll use against us next. We can't afford to let our guard down…

speaker: Marianne
text: I never used to care whether I lived or died… But after seeing so much death firsthand, I now realize how precious life truly is. I'm ashamed of how arrogant I was to think that death could mean so little…

speaker: Hilda
text: I wonder how far we can get with this plan. Dressing up like Imperial soldiers to sneak in. Claude said it could use some refinement. Any ideas?

speaker: Byleth
text: We could dress you as the emperor.

speaker: Hilda
text: Dress me as Edelgard?! But we look nothing alike!

speaker: Byleth
text: We could dress Claude as a woman.

speaker: Hilda
text: Claude, dressed as a woman? I don't understand what the point of that would be.

speaker: Hilda
text: On second thought, let's just stick to the plan as originally conceived. That seems safer.

speaker: Leonie
text: Claude takes care of the strategy, you direct the troops, and the rest of us focus on the fighting. As long as the system keeps working, we can win any battle, no matter the odds. That's what everyone's saying anyway. Hope you can keep up with our expectations, Professor.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Dimitri, the late Prince of Faerghus. He despised the Empire with all his heart. He should not have tried leading an army while his emotions were holding him captive.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leaders are people too.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leaders can't be emotional?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: No. If a leader's emotions overcome them, others must step in to prevent poor decision-making. Why did his followers not intervene? His attendants? I used to call Edelgard my leader, and now she is running amok. I am duty-bound to stop her.

speaker: Linhardt
text: There's word that Claude has developed a rather interesting stratagem to capture the fortress. You know Fort Merceus's nickname, I assume. The Stubborn Old General? But there must be one or two gaps in its defenses...

speaker: Caspar
text: Fort Merceus is next, huh? Ah, the memories. It's a huge stronghold in my father's domain. The town's completely surrounded by high walls. I used to run around there when I was a kid... Way back when a fortress was just a playground for me. Yeah, those were the days.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: It's always relaxing coming back here. But it's hard to relax knowing we have to go out on another expedition again so soon. And assaulting that huge keep? That sounds hard. Oh, really hard! Don't you think it'll be hard?!

speaker: Byleth
text: It's going to be tough.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I knew you'd think so! I knew you-- Ow! Oh, ow. Can't believe I tried to hug you through the door.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll be fine.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Of course you'd say that. Why did I even bother asking?

speaker: Dorothea
text: So many people died in the battle at Gronder... And here we are, preparing for the next battle, as if nothing happened the day before. It's almost easier to think of war as theater, with the stage an entire continent.

speaker: Byleth
text: Though the actors die, the show goes on?

speaker: Dorothea
text: Something like that. If an accident happens on stage, the next day's performance must unaffected.

speaker: Byleth
text: It really doesn't seem like theater.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Even if an accident happens on stage, the next day you have to sing as though nothing happened.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Everyone just pretends like everything is fine... focusing on their role in the play.

speaker: Petra
text: I have excitement in my heart for secret tactics! I enjoy attacks that are surprising.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why's that?

speaker: Byleth
text: Because it's like hunting?

speaker: Petra
text: Yes. Hunting is doing surprise attacks on prey.

speaker: Petra
text: Surprise attacks are safe with friends. Fewer injuries.

speaker: Felix
text: My relationship with the boar prince began even before I was born. He was always by my side. You might even say that, at one time, we were best friends.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean, best friends?

speaker: Byleth
text: What happened?

speaker: Felix
text: I couldn't fathom the depth of his hatred for the Empire. So much anguish. Could I have saved him? Could I have stopped him?

speaker: Ashe
text: I've heard Dedue's passed on. Just like His Highness.

speaker: Byleth
text: We can't know that for certain.

speaker: Ashe
text: That's true. I did hear that his body was never found.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't believe everything you hear.

speaker: Ashe
text: You're right. I don't think anyone's found his body, so I guess he might still be out there.

speaker: Byleth
text: Dedue is dead?

speaker: Ashe
text: That's what I've heard, but no one's found his body.

speaker: Ashe
text: If, somehow, he's still alive...I hope we'll meet again.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ya know, Professor, laying siege to a keep is like asking a girl out on a date. First, you get past her defenses...then you make your move.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's not the best analogy.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Trust me, I know what I'm talking about. I'm a seasoned veteran at this kind of thing. Girls, I mean. I've never actually, you know, captured any keeps...

speaker: Byleth
text: You might be right.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ha! I knew you'd get it, Professor.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Anyway, you know more about tactics than me, so I don't know why I'm offering you advice.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh, Goddess, hear my prayer. Please bless the deceased with peace everlasting...And may his soul rest in tranquility. You know, I used to see him praying quite often when I would come to the cathedral at night. I wonder who it was he prayed for back then...

speaker: Annette
text: After the battle at Gronder, some people claim they saw my father. They said he walked off the battlefield clutching… His Highness's dead body… So long as Father's alive, I don't need anything else. I just… I hope to see him again one day…

speaker: Ingrid
text: Among our prisoners of war, there were quite a few people who served His Highness. One of them stated that the Empire was involved with the Tragedy of Duscur. If this is true, His Highness's motives seem clear. I can't help but feel that perhaps I should have fought by his side…

speaker: Byleth
text: Why is that?

speaker: Ingrid
text: Because…I, too, lost someone to that tragedy—the most important person in my world.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you having regrets?

speaker: Ingrid
text: No. Not anymore. I am where I belong.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Those of us still on this plane of existence will carry the torch. The inhumane actions of the Empire must not be repeated.

speaker: Seteth
text: Fort Merceus is a keep that was constructed to defend the Imperial Capital, Enbarr. We cannot enter the capital without first capturing that fort. But once we have it, the city should be almost entirely at our mercy. Whatever strategy you have in mind, I have faith that it will lead to victory.

speaker: Flayn
text: Standing face to face with those whom I went to school with. On the field of battle… How inhuman war is - how horrifying. My heart feels shattered. It is my hope that this war marks the end of such foolish behavior.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Fort Merceus is the Empire's single most fortified military installation. Utterly impregnable, they say. I wonder, do you happen to know the nickname given to Fort Merceus?

speaker: Byleth
text: The Silver Maiden.

speaker: Hanneman
text: No, I'm afraid that name refers to the Fortress City of Arianrhod.

speaker: Byleth
text: Fódlan's Locket.

speaker: Hanneman
text: That one is a fortress that stands at Fódlan's Throat.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Stubborn Old General.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Indeed! A very good answer, but of course you'd know that.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Seems Fódlans give everyone and everything a nickname. Why, you were called the Ashen Demon! Myself, I have been called the Father of Crestology, which is a nickname as well as a title, I suppose...

speaker: Manuela
text: Each step closer to Enbarr, I'm reminded of another part of my past. Riches and poverty, glory and failure, that city has it all! And if I'm honest... sometimes I miss it. That's how the past works though, isn't it? It's always a different story than what you really lived.

speaker: Alois
text: Hilda's quite a tactician! Disguising ourselves as enemy soldiers to sneak in, undetected. A stroke of brilliance. With this strategy, we can really snatch victory from the jaws of...deceit!

speaker: Byleth
text: That's a good point.

speaker: Alois
text: Yes... With you leading our fighters, I've no doubt the Empire will suffer an embarrassing deceit. Get it? Deceit? Again?

speaker: Byleth
text: That's a bad pun.

speaker: Alois
text: Ah, rats! You've seen through my cunning punning!

speaker: Catherine
text: I hardly recognize everyone... Their faces have changed so much. More experience in the eyes, and more pain. I'm glad that they're stronger, but I hate to think that they've all become hardened killers. Look after them, OK? Try to keep 'em on the straight-and-narrow.

speaker: Shamir
text: Please tell Claude not to give us any more ridiculous orders. I've reached out through all of my channels, but there are limits to these things. I'll have to recruit an entire town's worth of people if I ever plan on making enough Imperial uniforms.

speaker: Cyril
text: Guess what I noticed. I can see further than most other people can see. But I can't figure the point of seeing further than an arrow can fly, since I can't shoot what I see.

speaker: Byleth
text: You could detect enemy movements in advance.

speaker: Cyril
text: I suppose I could see a whole horde of enemies coming and run away. That's kinda useful, at least.

speaker: Byleth
text: You could find our targets quicker than anyone.

speaker: Cyril
text: Yeah, I suppose it could be real useful for finding Lady Rhea too.

speaker: Cyril
text: Thanks, Professor. I think I get it now. I'm gonna put my eyes to real good use.

speaker: Judith
text: Ah, Professor. I have a question for you… Have you heard of the Death Knight? I'm referring to that Imperial general who has been operating under that moniker.

speaker: Byleth
text: I've heard of him.

speaker: Judith
text: Nothing is certain yet, but I get the feeling we'll have to face him soon enough.

speaker: Byleth
text: I haven't heard of him.

speaker: Judith
text: Well now… I don't know very much myself. Only that he's caused a great deal of havoc in the west. Nothing is certain yet, but I get the feeling we'll have to face him soon enough.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Is it true that we'll be assaulting Fort Merceus next? That doesn't sound like the brightest idea... I've heard that it's built to withstand an attack from even the largest of armies! Not to tell you how to do your job, but don't do it! I'm not ready to say my final good-byes to everyone...

speaker: Ignatz
text: I delivered our letter to Fort Merceus. I don't think they suspected anything.

speaker: Claude
text: I knew I was right to entrust that task to you. You've got that honest kind of face that makes it easy to fool people.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Is that meant to be a compliment?

speaker: Lysithea
text: What did you write in the letter?

speaker: Claude
text: I informed them that reinforcements were on the way. It would have been suspicious for troops to show up unannounced.

speaker: Hilda
text: So, the plan is...

speaker: Claude
text: We'll disguise ourselves as reinforcements from the Imperial capital and sneak in to Fort Merceus.

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh! You used my disguise plan after all!

speaker: Claude
text: We've also procured Imperial army uniforms.

speaker: Hilda
text: Ooh, good work. I knew this was the only way!

speaker: Claude
text: However... That alone wouldn't be enough.

speaker: Hilda
text: You did say the plan needed a little more refinement. Are you going to dress up like Edelgard, Claude?

speaker: Claude
text: I'm not sure that would accomplish much. In the letter, I included the name of the Imperial general leading the reinforcements. While we're heading to the fort, a separate army is going to attack us.

speaker: Marianne
text: We're going to be attacked?!

speaker: Claude
text: That's all just for show, though. It'll be our allies who are attacking us.

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh, I get it! We're going to make it look like the Alliance is attacking Imperial reinforcements!

speaker: Claude
text: Right. When the troops in the fortress panic and open up the gates... We're in.

speaker: Judith
text: I'd love nothing more than for this plan to work, but I've got some bad news for you. Apparently the notorious Death Knight has been placed in charge of defending Fort Merceus.

speaker: Marianne
text: The one who kidnapped Flayn...

speaker: Flayn
text: The Death Knight... I did not wish to ever think of him again.

speaker: Judith
text: He got some acclaim in the battle to subjugate western Faerghus. They say he holds the most military prowess in the Empire.

speaker: Claude
text: Even so, we've got Teach here to command us. All will be well. You have to trust us.

speaker: Judith
text: So your big plan is to just trust your professor? Really, boy?

speaker: Leonie
text: Under the professor's guidance, I'm sure we'll manage somehow. We're counting on the tactics you learned from Captain Jeralt!

speaker: Claude
text: Prepare yourselves, everyone. It's time.

speaker: Claude
text: Teach... This is for your ears only, but there's actually one more part to my plan. I had hoped it wouldn't come to this, but I have no choice.

speaker: Byleth
text: No choice?

speaker: Claude
text: Absolutely. We can't afford to hold anything back. Thanks to Edelgard's strength, the Imperial army is more unified than I would have expected. It was a painful realization, but after our battle at Gronder Field, it's clear that we can't win if we don't pull out all the stops. I also realized something else during that battle. There really is something special about you, Teach. The reason we were all able to keep our cool in the midst of the chaos was because we all trust in you. In your command and in your strength. Everyone here believes that we will win as long as we have you on our side. Our faith in you is borderline religious. You and I... We have what it takes to free Fódlan from the Empire's rule. I know in my heart that we'll make it through to witness the world after all the fighting has ceased.

speaker: Death Knight
text: That man/woman approaches...

speaker: Caspar
text: Who are you talking about? You don't mean that professor, do you?! Doesn't matter. No one could take this fortress.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Ugh, sounds like a bother... I'll be taking a nap about now.

speaker: Death Knight
text: Will death's scythe claim you... Or will I fall to that sword of yours...

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: General, reinforcements have arrived from the capital. They clashed with Alliance forces in the outskirts of the city, but should enter the fortress soon.

speaker: Death Knight
text: You let them in? Make haste and slaughter them all.

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Huh? Why?

speaker: Death Knight
text: They are enemies. Slaughter them all. I will not say it again.

speaker: Claude
text: We made it in. Professor, take control from the south. I have my own task to do from here. There are preparations to be made for our secret plan.

speaker: Nader
text: I see your skills haven't dulled yet, kiddo.

speaker: Claude
text: What did you expect?

speaker: Claude
text: Everyone, listen up! From now on, the Almyran forces will be fighting by our side!

speaker: Claude
text: We'll work as one! And we will bring down that fort together!

speaker: Claude
text: An impregnable fortress is a wide-open prairie once you get inside. From here, we'll attack from the north and south at once!

speaker: Nader
text: No different than a prairie, you say? Heh! You've got a strange head on your shoulders, kiddo

speaker: Claude
text: For Nader the Undefeated, this should be as easy as a walk in a meadow, right?

speaker: Nader
text: Heh. Well, goddess or death god or whoever they may be, let's crush them to dust.

speaker: Death Knight
text: The time of ruin draws near... But their slaughter must wait until next we meet...

speaker: Alliance Soldier
text: Report! The Death Knight has escaped the fortress!

speaker: Claude
text: He gave up too easily. Does he have some other plan? Let's deal with the remaining enemies and go after him, quickly!

speaker: Death Knight
text: The time is ripe.

speaker: Alliance Soldier
text: Report! The Death Knight is moving! It looks like they're abandoning the fortress and making an escape!

speaker: Claude
text: We need to put an end to this here and now. Come on, let's circle around and cut off his retreat.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, how long's it been? Five years? Who'd have thought you'd end up an Imperial general...

speaker: Death Knight
text: So, you wish to die.

speaker: Claude
text: Heh. As antisocial and unhinged as ever, I see.

speaker: Nader
text: Hey, kiddo! What was with that... javelin of... light?

speaker: Claude
text: Javelin of light... That describes it pretty well. The fortress was supposedly impregnable, but look at it now.It's hard to imagine that the Empire would do something like that. But if not them, then who? And for what purpose? If they wanted to kill us, then why wait until now to use it?

speaker: Judith
text: We almost died just now... and without an answer to any of that. Speaking of unanswered questions, why is Nardel here? Care to explain? I get the feeling there's something you two are keeping from us.

speaker: Nader
text: I'll go ahead and see my subordinates off to Almyra, kiddo.

speaker: Claude
text: Wait, Nader! Are really going to just leave me here and run away?

speaker: Nader
text: I hope to see you again, Judith. And you too, Professor. I'll be praying for your safety!

speaker: Judith
text: Nader? Are you saying that Nardel is actually Nader the Unstoppable?!

speaker: Byleth
text: Unstoppable?

speaker: Claude
text: It's actually Nader the Undefeated. Almyrans love grand titles.

speaker: Judith
text: I knew he was no ordinary person, but to think he was the great hero of Almyra...

speaker: Hilda
text: Hey, um, can we really afford to be chatting right now? If another one of those javelins of light falls, we're all dead!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Claude. There are things I wish to ask you, but first we must hurry and withdraw.

speaker: Claude
text: Right you are. Come on, everyone! Let's hurry up and get out of here.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Claude. It is time for you to explain. Why are you so close with an Almyran general?

speaker: Claude
text: Well, he did quite a bit for me when I was younger.

speaker: Lorenz
text: When you were younger... So, before you joined House Riegan. How and where did you meet him? There aren't many opportunities to meet a general from Almyra in Fódlan...

speaker: Claude
text: If that's what you believe, it's only because that's what you've been led to believe. After all, we have Cyril here among our allies, and he was born in Almyra.

speaker: Cyril
text: Hey, now. Don't drag me into this.

speaker: Claude
text: There's a big, wide world outside of Fódlan, and it's overflowing with different places and cultures. You think interacting with outsiders is odd, but isn't avoiding contact with the outside world far more unnatural?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Don't change the subject, Claude. To the people of the Alliance, the Almyrans are-

speaker: Claude
text: It's true that there's a history of hostility, but why should that mean we're doomed to remain hostile forever? The Almyrans aren't monsters. Just look at Cyril! Does he look like a monster to you?

speaker: Cyril
text: Hey, what's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Claude
text: Right, Teach? What did you think when you met Nader?

speaker: Byleth
text: He's... interesting.

speaker: Byleth
text: He's a reliable general.

speaker: Claude
text: Ha! I'll tell him you said that. And I'm sure that if all of you got to know him, all of your preconceived notions would change too. I know you guys, and you aren't the type of people to reject someone without trying to get to know them.

speaker: Hilda
text: But... how did those Almyrans even get past Fódlan's Throat? I doubt my brother would just let them pass without saying anything...

speaker: Claude
text: About that... I actually made sure your brother met Nader in advance.

speaker: Lorenz
text: What?! Lord Holst met with an Almyran general?

speaker: Hilda
text: Oh, so that's why you were so interested in my brother. But wait, they're supposed to be bitter enemies! They've fought each other several times before!

speaker: Claude
text: I know. It was a big gamble. But rather than having me try to convince them myself, I knew it would be easier to just have them meet. They were taken aback at first, but sure enough, they hit it off. They were even drinking to their newfound brotherhood before parting.

speaker: Judith
text: It makes sense. If you take the greatest heroes away from the battlefield, of course they'll get along.

speaker: Hilda
text: Fighting one minute and drinking together the next... Men are so weird!

speaker: Claude
text: Ultimately, someone's bloodline has nothing to do with the friendships they forge. Relations between the Alliance and Almyra is a matter we'll tackle in the future. Still, I want to take this opportunity to make one thing clear to all of you. After we defeat the Empire, I intend to tear down the walls that separate Fódlan from the outside world. I want to let people and goods come and go freely, and in doing so, eradicate prejudices about the outside world.

speaker: Cyril
text: Huh?!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Would it even be possible to achieve such a thing? It directly contradicts the Seiros tenets.

speaker: Claude
text: Does it? I'm not so sure. I'm any case, I'm prepared for the inevitable protests and criticism. New ways of doing things are always met with resistance. During our time at the Officer's Academy, all of you overcame the barriers of birthplace, status, and ideology. Having gone through so much with all of you, I have no doubt that, in time, you'll understand.

speaker: Hilda
text: I guess there were a lot of different people there. People we wouldn't have met through the normal course of our lives.

speaker: Claude
text: Duscur once opposed the Kingdom, but there was someone from Duscur there. Brigid once invaded the Empire, but the Brigid princess was there. We ate at the same table as those people. Sure, sometimes we didn't get along. But other times, we helped each other out. Can we really draw a definitive line in the sand and say one group of people is all good, and another all bad? If I can realize my dream, Fódlan will be reborn. The old age will end and we'll welcome a new dawn.

speaker: Lorenz
text: But, if-

speaker: Judith
text: Save your objections for another day, Gloucester boy.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Ugh...

speaker: Judith
text: That said, there are more pressing matters to discuss. Our next step is to invade the Imperial capital, right?

speaker: Claude
text: That's right. I'm sure Edelgard is eagerly awaiting our arrival in Enbarr. Reinforcements from the Alliance lords should arrive soon. Let's make sure we're ready to greet them.

speaker: Rhea
text: I am happy to see you two…

speaker: Claude
text: Sorry to interrupt your rest. But there are some things that we absolutely must ask you.

speaker: Rhea
text: It seems I do not have much time left. I do not intend to hide anything any longer.

speaker: Claude
text: Rhea… I have to ask. You're the Immaculate One, aren't you? If what I'm thinking is correct, that's what the children of the goddess is referring to. In other words, you—

speaker: Rhea
text: I am the last child of the progenitor god. A long time ago, the progenitor god came from somewhere far away and descended upon this continent. She changed her form to resemble that of a human, and gave her own blood to birth her children. The progenitor god and her children shared knowledge and skills with the people of the land. Together, they built a prosperous civilization. But the humans turned their backs on the teachings of the progenitor god and engaged in senseless wars. Eventually people began to think of themselves as gods and challenged the progenitor god herself to battle. The land was scorched in the war that ensured and the majority of humans were annihilated. I believe that those who slither in the dark are the descendants of those who retreated beneath the ground during that time.

speaker: Claude
text: So they had been waiting all that time for their chance at revenge…

speaker: Rhea
text: It took the progenitor god an astonishing amount of time to revive the ravaged world. But eventually, the continent found peace again, and the progenitor god, having fulfilled her duty, fell into a long slumber in the Holy Tomb. The children who stayed behind built a settlement in Zanado to protect the Holy Tomb as they quietly lived out their lives. But then…Nemesis appeared, bringing tragedy along with him. Even now I cannot forget the sight…of that massive canyon, painted red with blood… I was never able to forgive those who proudly wielded weapons crafted from the corpses of my brethren. I was the only survivor of Zanado, and all I could do was wander across Fódlan clinging to my desperate desire for revenge. I called myself Seiros, fostered the founding of the Empire, and prepared to oppose Nemesis and his followers.

speaker: Claude
text: Unbelievable…

speaker: Rhea
text: I put Zanado behind me to gather the remaining children who were scattered across Fódlan… Finally, we killed Nemesis on the Tailtean Plains, and I took back the Sword of the Creator.

speaker: Claude
text: Let me get this straight… Saint Seiros…is you?! You're kidding me, right?

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Professor. Claude. There's something you need to hear right away…

speaker: Rhea
text: If you have something to report, do so at once. There is no need to let my presence worry you.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: As you wish… We're receiving a constant stream of express messengers from cities to the east. They claim that an unidentified military force is attacking and that there have already been a large number of casualties.

speaker: Claude
text: What?!

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: The reports indicate that the cities and towns along the East Gronder Thoroughfare in the old Hrym territory have already been destroyed. Some villages were razed completely, leaving no survivors…

speaker: Claude
text: Damn it! Did they come from Shambhala? Could it be that there were some remnants of that wicked group hiding there?

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: I have a report! The unidentified military force has crossed the Great Bridge of Myrddin! Alliance forces met them in battle, but it seems they have already broken through!

speaker: Claude
text: They've already made it so far. Is Count Gloucester unharmed?

speaker: Hilda
text: The count is fine, but apparently my brother joined with reinforcements and was gravely injured…

speaker: Claude
text: You mean to tell me they easily got past a general as skilled as Holst?

speaker: Hilda
text: They say the enemy general has a weapon that resembles the Sword of the Creator. Even my brother was powerless to stop him…

speaker: Byleth
text: The Sword of the Creator?

speaker: Claude
text: That's not possible…

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: The enemy forces are flying a banner bearing the Crest of Flames as they continue their march west along the Airmid River.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: We believe they're marching toward Garreg Mach. We are preparing to meet them in battle.

speaker: Rhea
text: A weapon that resembles the Sword of the Creator… and banner bearing the Crest of Flames… There is only one explanation. The one leading the enemy force…is Nemesis himself.

speaker: Claude
text: Nemesis? That Nemesis? Do you really think the ancient King of Liberation has been brought back to life?

speaker: Rhea
text: Perhaps the seal was broken when Shambhala fell… An incredible power that we children cannot hope to match dwells within the blood of the progenitor god. Nemesis obtained that blood, so it would not surprise me if that were the case.

speaker: Claude
text: The blood of the progenitor god… That's right, he did take the remains from the Holy Tomb, didn't he…

speaker: Rhea
text: From the blood of the progenitor god, Sothis, he acquired the Crest of Flames. From her bones and heart, he crafted the Sword of the Creator.

speaker: Claude
text: The Sword of the Creator is made from her bones and heart?

speaker: Rhea
text: The heart of Sothis is the Crest Stone that was placed in the Sword of the Creator. The same is true of the Crests of the 10 Elites and the other Crest Stones… They were born of the blood and hearts of the progenitor god's children. Those who slither in the dark created them. Stole them. Sothis never gifted that power to the humans.

speaker: Claude
text: The Crests of the 10 Elites, the Crest Stones, and the Heroes' Relics… I can't believe those who slither in the dark made them all. And after that, Nemesis used the Sword of the Creator to massacre all of the progenitor god's children in Zanado… In other words, the citizens of Zanado were killed by weapons made from the remains of their brethren… How atrocious. But I don't get it… The Sword of the Creator that Teach wields doesn't have a Crest Stone. So how is Teach able to wield its full power?

speaker: Rhea
text: The Crest Stone of the progenitor god…dwells within your professor.

speaker: Rhea
text: After I battled with Nemesis as Saint Seiros, I reclaimed the heart of Sothis. I wanted to use that heart to…resurrect her. Even though I had to do some…questionable things to achieve that goal, I wished to see Sothis…my mother…once more.

speaker: Byleth
text: You placed her heart in me?

speaker: Rhea
text: Yes. I believed that if I could resurrect my mother, I could regain all that had been lost…

speaker: Claude
text: So…that's the truth of it.

speaker: Rhea
text: I suspected that your body housed the consciousness of Sothis. Those suspicions were correct. And yet, she merely gave you her power and vanished… My dearest wish did not come true… But you did inherit the power of the progenitor god. Now, you must use that power to defeat Nemesis once and for all. Fódlan's blood-stained history…must end.

speaker: Claude
text: Huh… What a magnificent tale! It's enough to make your head spin. Rhea's real identity is Saint Seiros, and the one who attacked us was Nemesis, the King of Liberation! On top of that, you've got the heart of the goddess in you! My flabber is completely gasted right now. But now isn't the time for standing around in disbelief. Nemesis has made it this far for a reason. If we aren't victorious, that's it for Fódlan's new dawn. The world will forever be shrouded in darkness… This is the final, FINAL battle. Finally. My friend… Please give it your all out there!

speaker: Lorenz
text: A sudden invasion from Nemesis has plunged the Alliance territories into complete disarray. Against such overwhelming strength, my father and his forces had no choice but to retreat.

speaker: Byleth
text: Wise decision.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm glad he's survived.

speaker: Lorenz
text: It was certainly prudent for him to avoid a fruitless death. But as things stand, he will not leave much of an impression on history. So that falls to me. I will do all that I can—for the future of Fódlan, and the glory of House Gloucester!

speaker: Raphael
text: Hey, Professor! Have you heard from Claude? He says he's gonna throw a feast if we win the next battle! Enough food to clean out the stores!

speaker: Byleth
text: That sounds great!

speaker: Byleth
text: So what?

speaker: Raphael
text: So I'm super motivated to win! I'm gonna train every muscle I got! I'm coming for you, Nemesis! I'm coming for you, feast!

speaker: Ignatz
text: I got the gist of it from Claude. Those who slither in the dark… They seem to be descended from humans who were forced deep underground after the goddess defeated them.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's what I heard.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is that right?

speaker: Ignatz
text: They were trying to wipe out the goddess and her followers in hopes of taking back the surface. That's why they called themselves saviors. To their mind, they were.

speaker: Lysithea
text: It seems there are some Shambhala loyalists in Nemesis's forces. As long as they're around, we can expect them to continue with their cruel experiments.

speaker: Byleth
text: We must win.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's wipe them out, then.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Yes. We have to. It's the only way to ensure nobody else will go through what I went through. We must obliterate them in the next battle. It's the only recompense for Edelgard's death.

speaker: Marianne
text: Just when we thought we'd made it to the end, another enemy approaches… Can we be sure this battle is the last one?

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Marianne
text: Of course, there's no way to really know what will happen.

speaker: Byleth
text: This is it, I think.

speaker: Marianne
text: I think you're right.

speaker: Marianne
text: Just a little further to the end. Come on, Professor. We have to win!

speaker: Hilda
text: My big brother challenged Nemesis. He knew he couldn't win. He just did it so that his friends could escape. He emerged from the battle with a terrible injury. It's a miracle he didn't die.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm glad he made it.

speaker: Hilda
text: Yeah. Me too.

speaker: Byleth
text: That was so noble of him.

speaker: Hilda
text: Well, maybe he should have been a little less noble. When you're dead, you're dead.

speaker: Hilda
text: Dying to save someone else…seems to defeat the purpose. I wouldn't do it. He's alive, and in spite of myself, I'm really proud of him.

speaker: Leonie
text: So, we're defending Fódlan's future, huh? Kind of makes my mercenary ambitions feel pretty small. So I'll think about my promise to Captain Jeralt to protect you instead. That'll be my reason to fight.

speaker: Byleth
text: Thank you.

speaker: Byleth
text: That works.

speaker: Leonie
text: If I can get you through this in one piece, that's just as good as defending Fódlan's future, isn't it? I just hope he's watching.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: The javelins of light that destroyed Fort Merceus… They are what destroyed Shambhala. They were trying to shroud the city in darkness. Perhaps they were planning to swallow us up in that same darkness. Maybe the javelins of light were a signal to Nemesis. To awaken him from his long slumber. What do you think, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: I think you're exactly right.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Yes, indeed. I have done some good pondering here.

speaker: Byleth
text: I think you're way off the mark.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Oh! Really? Hm. Maybe I got a couple of things wrong, but I thought I was pretty close…

speaker: Ferdinand
text: If we keep up this momentum, we will be able to take down Nemesis and restore peace in Fódlan.

speaker: Linhardt
text: When you think of it, as one approaches the end of a war, the sacrifices only grow larger, don't they? The winning side musters their forces and attempts to strike a decisive blow... While those of the losing side make desperate attempts to turn the war in their favor. Neither side will give. I only wish we'd consider those who lose their lives in that struggle.

speaker: Byleth
text: We're far from being safe ourselves.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Yes, exactly my point. Let's be careful to ensure we don't lose our lives, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a necessary sacrifice.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Perhaps, but that doesn't make it any easier to accept your own survival depends on a throw of the dice.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's better than dragging the war out.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I can appreciate that, but just because a choice is better does not mean that it's good.

speaker: Caspar
text: Everyone in Fódlan's united, but the Whatstheirfaces in the Dark or whatever won't let up! Let's get rid of 'em right away!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's do it.

speaker: Caspar
text: We gotta get some training in so we can crush 'em!

speaker: Byleth
text: We can't let our guard down.

speaker: Caspar
text: I know that! Come on, let's go train so we can crush 'em!

speaker: Caspar
text: There's not a lot of time, but I'm afraid we won't win if we don't train!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: The King of Liberation? The Fell King? His name is Nemesis, right? And he was hidden away for over a thousand years. Wow, that's a really long time all to himself… But that doesn't make him worth admiring, no matter how much I envy him!

speaker: Byleth
text: You really envy him?

speaker: Byleth
text: You'd like to be shut away for a thousand years?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Um. Maybe. Is that a trick question?

speaker: Dorothea
text: I keep thinking the war is near its end, then it isn't... When can we finally put this dreadful war behind us?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's end it with the next battle.

speaker: Dorothea
text: That would be wonderful. Imagine, the last moment of combat...then peace. It sounds like a fairy tale. I want to make this a world a place where there is no fighting, where children can grow up happy and safe.

speaker: Byleth
text: There can be no end to war.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I suppose you're right... But we should still try our best to make the world a place where children can grow up happy and safe.

speaker: Petra
text: I can feel a weight in the air. It is different from before. I do not know this Nemesis person, except what I have been reading. But I am not of Fódlan. My knowledge of this person is very little. Even so, I feel that...I can understand it. I know that our enemy has great strength. I am...feeling great fear for this battle.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't worry.

speaker: Petra
text: I have belief in you, Professor. Together, we will not be losing.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm scared too.

speaker: Petra
text: You have fear too? You do not look like you do... I have gratitude... I mean, I am grateful that you told me.

speaker: Felix
text: The Fell King Nemesis. Hmph. I imagine he'll be a worthy opponent. How many foes have tasted my blade? He will be an excellent finale. We will be victorious, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes, we will!

speaker: Felix
text: Splendid. Let's do it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Calm down.

speaker: Felix
text: I'm perfectly calm, thank you.

speaker: Ashe
text: The King of Liberation wakes after a thousand-year slumber. Feels like I'm living a nightmare.

speaker: Byleth
text: I feel the same way.

speaker: Ashe
text: You too? I hope you're not following my lead on this one, Professor!

speaker: Byleth
text: We must accept it.

speaker: Ashe
text: I know you're right, but it still doesn't feel real.

speaker: Ashe
text: Maybe this Nemesis who's attacking us isn't even the real thing. Either way, the damage and death he's causing are real enough. I will fight to protect those who need it.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Just when we think we're in the clear, the legendary Fell King resurrects. Who'd have thought it? Can you handle this getting any weirder? I don't know if I can.

speaker: Byleth
text: I can sympathize with you.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I don't know how much of this Nemesis guy is a legend and how much is true, but I know this...

speaker: Byleth
text: No time for complaining.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I want to− I'm going to survive. I've spent this whole war afraid I'd die. Not anymore. I'm going to live.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I mean, I'll still fight like I want to die because that's worked so far, and why change at this late date, right?

speaker: Sylvain
text: And if I'm right and I don't die, would you go have dinner with me sometime?

speaker: Mercedes
text: We went through all that trouble to finish the war, and now we have to fight again? What does this Nemesis fellow have against Garreg Mach anyway?

speaker: Byleth
text: A vendetta...

speaker: Mercedes
text: A vendetta against Garreg Mach? That doesn't make much sense at all.

speaker: Byleth
text: I have no idea...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Well, it doesn't make much sense to me either.

speaker: Mercedes
text: At any rate, I'll do what I can to defend the monastery and Lady Rhea.

speaker: Annette
text: Is Lady Rhea OK? She was quite weakened to start, and then she took all those heavy injuries… I don't want to imagine it, but what will happen if Lady Rhea passes away like this?

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll cross that bridge if we come to it.

speaker: Annette
text: I suppose you're right.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sure she'll be fine.

speaker: Annette
text: Yes. I'm praying every day that she'll get as well as soon as possible.

speaker: Annette
text: Come what may, we should all combine our talents and defend the peace of Fódlan!

speaker: Ingrid
text: Shambhala is destroyed. But are they vanquished entirely, I wonder… Just as Kronya took Monica's form, perhaps there are some others living above ground.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Byleth
text: Quite possibly.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Once this battle is over, I still have much to see to. But right now, I should focus on the task at hand. On Nemesis. As long as Nemesis stands, both my future and the future of Fódlan hang in the balance.

speaker: Seteth
text: Before the monastery was completed, there was a massive battle on the Tailtean Plains. In that battle, the warrior Seiros defeated the Fell King Nemesis and reclaimed the bones and heart of Sothis. Those make up the divine sword that you wield, and the Crest that you bear. Now, Rhea…Seiros…lies helpless. The only one who can defeat this so-called King of Liberation is the inheritor of divine power. You have our full and unwavering support. Only you can do this. Please, save this world.

speaker: Flayn
text: Please keep quiet. Rhea is sleeping right now. She does not appear to be very well. I beg of you, please do everything you can to prevent an assault from Nemesis.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Shambhala… An underground city with an entirely different lineage than the goddess? Shame phenomena, driven by a source totally alien to the Crests that we understand. Most unsettling! Could it be magic? Some manner of technology? I would like to know the truth of it all. Very much so. I want to know their history, their knowledge. Why do you suppose they chose this place to occupy?

speaker: Byleth
text: Well, I don't know.

speaker: Hanneman
text: I intend to carry out multiple excavations around the city. There is so much to learn! Yet first we face battle with a king who has defied time. Hmm, yes. The excavations can wait, I think.

speaker: Manuela
text: Life can be tough, you know? But if you've got your friends to help you through, it can be a lot easier. Maybe you butt heads sometimes…but that's OK. That's how you build bonds, right? And I've got friends, Professor. Plenty of those. It's true love that seems to have passed me by.

speaker: Byleth
text: You should relax.

speaker: Manuela
text: Relax? I'm relaxed.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's still hope.

speaker: Manuela
text: But where is my true love to be found? Where is my ray of hope?

speaker: Byleth
text: Time to give up?

speaker: Manuela
text: Yeah… I'm starting to figure that's the most realistic option.

speaker: Manuela
text: At this point, I'm just hoping you stay single too. Then at least we can share each other's misery!

speaker: Alois
text: We thought we'd taken down the mastermind of this war, and then the Fell King Nemesis shows up! Well, no matter what evil creatures we have to face, this old soul will keep defending Garreg Mach. Not only Garreg Mach. Also Lady Rhea. Also you. I think Jeralt would be saying the same kind of thing if he were here right now.

speaker: Catherine
text: I try not to think about what would happen if Lady Rhea were harmed. I can't bear the thought of it. I'm not sure why the Fell King Nemesis picked right now to come back to life. But it makes me angry, that's for sure! Let's kick him back down into the dirt, where he belongs.

speaker: Shamir
text: Ghosts rising up from the ancient ruins… Heh… No matter how hard we push back, they don't stop coming. They're persistent. I'll give them that.

speaker: Cyril
text: I hear some super strong and evil fellas are after Lady Rhea. She just barely made it back to Garreg Mach, and then this has to go and happen? I'll protect Lady Rhea as best I can, and you're gonna do the same thing, aren't ya, Professor? Yeah, I know you will! Cut 'em down, Professor! Get every last one of those guys!

speaker: Judith
text: Did you hear? Our enemy is Nemesis. Unbelievable. It sounds so crazy, but there's no laughing it off. We must make our move before they reach the monastery.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Professor! I just have to say thanks! For everything! I'm on high alert today, so don't you worry about a thing. This mysterious military force approaching Garreg Mach… Is it true that Nemesis is with them?! It was Nemesis who led the 10 Elites against Saint Seiros. It's the stuff of legend. But this time, he won't have the 10 Elites on his side. Right? He won't, right?!

speaker: Claude
text: What's the plan, my friend?

speaker: Byleth
text: We will defeat Nemesis.

speaker: Claude
text: I thought you'd say that. And of course, I'll be joining you. What about the rest of you? Our enemy is a monster of legend. As always, there's not a shred of proof that we can win.

speaker: Lorenz
text: A foolish inquiry, Claude. I must finish what my father started…

speaker: Hilda
text: Started? Your father ran away before the battle even began.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I…well. All the more reason why I, as his heir, cannot flee now!

speaker: Hilda
text: I'm in. I need to get back at him for hurting my brother. I'm not going to let him get away with it!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Wow… Hilda's serious about this!

speaker: Lysithea
text: I too will fight until the end. I wish to protect Fódlan's future.

speaker: Leonie
text: I feel the same as Lysithea. It would hardly be fitting for Captain Jeralt's apprentice to bow out now. I'll show them everything he taught me.

speaker: Marianne
text: I…I will give it my all as well! For the professor, for Claude, and for all of you who helped make me as strong as I am now!

speaker: Raphael
text: I'm in too! And when we're done, I'm gonna eat tons of steak to celebrate!

speaker: Ignatz
text: This truly is the final battle… At this point, you shouldn't have to ask, Claude. You know we're with you.

speaker: Claude
text: I do know that, Ignatz. But I had to ask just to make sure.

speaker: Judith
text: Heh. Look at how reliable you kids have become. You've trained them well, Professor. This Nemesis guy should be arriving soon. Is everyone ready?

speaker: Claude
text: It's finally time.

speaker: Byleth
text: I won't let us lose.

speaker: Byleth
text: I won't let any of you die.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's win this… Together!

speaker: Claude
text: I'm on board with that. Let's all make it through this alive. Let's defeat this dusty old King of Liberation and put an end to this history of lies. Once we've done that, there'll be nothing holding us back. A new and brighter age will begin. Let's go, my friend! Fódlan's new dawn awaits!

speaker: Claude
text: Nemesis is here…and with more soldiers than expected.

speaker: Hilda
text: A swamp, huh? But there’s something about it… It looks odd somehow.

speaker: Agarthan Soldier
text: Agh! Can’t…breathe…

speaker: Odesse
text: He should not have done that… Be careful. The water is poisonous to the living.

speaker: Claude
text: It looks like we’d better not get near that swamp… Try to avoid it during the fight!

speaker: Claude
text: Huh?! I think they’ve got some sort of magical link with Nemesis…

speaker: Marianne
text: Could the magic be protecting him?

speaker: Claude
text: Not sure, but we’d better take out his 10 commanders before taking him on.

speaker: Nemesis
text: Seiros! I will kill you! Do not get in my way!

speaker: Claude
text: So, that's Nemesis… You're a crusty old bastard, you know that?

speaker: Nemesis
text: All those who stand in my way…will be destroyed!

speaker: Raphael
text: Wah! Watch out, Claude! They're coming for us!

speaker: Claude
text: No effect!? So Nemesis is... invincible...

speaker: Claude
text: Nine more commanders remaining… We just killed number 10. These can’t be the 10 Elites, can they? Nah, not likely.

speaker: Hilda
text: Look! The swampland cleared!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Professor! Claude! All the subordinates to Nemesis have been eliminated!

speaker: Claude
text: It took some doing, but now’s our chance to face off against Nemesis!

speaker: Claude
text: Agh! Demonic Beasts flying in from the south… Someone here must be able to summon them!

speaker: Lysithea
text: I sense an unusual presence. Someone may be hiding there.

speaker: Odesse
text: Argh... Thales!

speaker: Claude
text: Now he can’t call any more Demonic Beasts. Time to see off his allies.

speaker: Claude
text: Now he can’t call any more Demonic Beasts. And the remaining forces of Shambhala have been defeated too.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Whoa. The swampland vanished.

speaker: Hilda
text: Look! The swampland cleared!

speaker: Claude
text: Hey… Can you speak?

speaker: Claude
text: Just puppets controlled by Nemesis… Well, they’re the strongest puppets I’ve ever known.

speaker: Nemesis
text: Feeble creature… Prepare to die!

speaker: Nemesis
text: That sword… You bear the Crest of Flames, just as I do!
